","Short Summary

column1: Hola!! Thank you for taking the time to read our funding campaign for the Artist's Residency and Exchange Puerto Rico 2013. This project is a collaboration with patio taller and their residency program el residencial.
First a little bit about the project:

The Artist’s Residency & Exchange is a 10 day cultural creative exchange between artists from Toronto, New York City, Australia and Puerto Rico. The residency includes space for creative exchange, discussions and teaching each other our approaches to art and performance making, as well as opportunities to develop our own work in a supportive and stimulating environment. It is our aim to support, ignite and grow each other’s creative practices, as well as engage with other artists in Puerto Rico to generate creative connection and conversation.

Common elements which bring the participating artists together include: the importance of framing our work with our politics, a desire to create shifts in ourselves and our communities through creative expression and to be a part of a creative community. Elements which are different in our practices may include the processes we use and the style of work we make.

This isn't the first time we do this. Back in September 2011 Sunny Drake and Awilda Rodríguez Lora met in Toronto for 7 days intensively where gave birth to two new solo works: “X” by Sunny Drake and “El Velorio de La Comay” by Awilda Rodríguez Lora.

Now 2 years later we are excited to come to Puerto Rico to collaborate with the organization patio taller as part of their residency program el residencial and they will be hosting 6 artists to have a time to focus on their individual creative practice and to exchange with other artist in the residency and with community members of patio taller.

patio taller is a creative space for artist and community members to meet and share. patio taller can be anywhere there is a space, it’s nature is to be mobile, but since 2011 their headquarters has been the casa e nonó(Nonó’s house) located in the neighborhood of San Anton, Carolina. Nonó’s granddaughters opened the space so it can become a meeting place for members of the community of San Anton. It is a place where the artist and the community can create and exchange while embracing sustainability and solidarity.

Thevision of patio taller is to promote a social/cultural exchange between community members and artist by having conversations, workshops, residencies and a creative practice that allows for an exchange of skills, stories and art. The space is open for artist that are already active in the community of San Anton and  artists in the island and abroad.
Dates of the Artist’s and Exchange Residency in PR 2013:
September 10 - 20th, 2013
Location: patio taller - San Anton-Carolina, PR
Participating Artists:
Awilda Rodríguez Lora (Puerto Rico)(laperformera.org)
Michelle Nonó (Puerto Rico)(patiotaller.org)
Lydela Leonor (Puerto Rico)(patiotaller.org)
Sunny Drake(Australia/Toronto)(sunnydrake.com)
Nisha Ahuja (Toronto)
Roxanna Vahed (Toronto)
Una Osato (New York City)
What We Need & What You Get
This is an independent project that is funded by each individual artist and patio taller
Each artist will be covering their traveling expenses, patio taller will support lodging and spaces for creating and exchanging work.

We hope that with this minimal funding goal of $700 will support the artists in their traveling expenses and patio taller with the cost of hosting the residency. Below is the estimated budget of a total of $3,015. This budget does not include production and services fees that are being donated by the artists and patio taller.
Have in mind that you can support us by not only donating to help us achieve our funding goal...but we hope to surpass this number with all your geneorous support. This will help us greatly.
Our estimated budget* is:
Traveling Expenses (Airline Tickets from Toronto & NYC) as of July 24,2013
Food:
Transportation: (gas, train, bus)
Services (water & electricity)
Cleaning supplies:
Miscellaneous:
total
*Budget is missing operation and services expenses that will be donated by patio taller and the artists.
The Impact
- Artistic and Cultural Exchange as a way of building support and a network for artists in Puerto Rico and abroad
- Exchange of skills and methodologies for the exploration and creation of artistic work.
- Community Conversations to learn from each other: How we are supporting our artistry in Puerto Rico and abroad? We have already to open events scheduled for the general public.
- Create and support a community/network of artists that are using their creative practice as a tool for social justice in their community and abroad.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can tell your friends, family and the world.

patio taller is a non-profit organization that works all year round providing workshops, services and space to members of the community in San Anton Carolina and are always grateful of any support you or your organization can provide.
Here a link to there site: http://patiotaller.org/",0.0,0,"4 Campaigns

UPDATE!!!
We've met our goal and want to give back!!! All the contributions made above our goal will go DIRECTLY towards creating more decks that will be donated!

Some will be included in care packages sent out by the TTTS Support Team. This is a group of moms that have experienced baby loss due to Twin-to-twin Transfusion Syndrome, that takes from their own pockets to create care packages for moms that have recently experienced a loss to TTTS as well.

In addition, I am working on connecting with a number of childrens hospitals in the area with the intention to distribute decks to moms of kids suffering from cancer and other diseases. I hope to offer them a little light amist their darkness. It will be a great daily positivity project for them to do together with their kids...
At the time of this writing there are only 5 days left to this campaign. PLEASE actively share it and help it spread so I can make tons of these decks and spread tons of Muchness where it's needed!!!
I'll be updating this page regularly so you can see your contibution / purchase at work!!
xoxoxox,
Tova

Make 2013 a MUCHNESS filled year!!
~~~~30 Day Deck of Muchness Moments~~~~
What’s Muchness?

Muchness is the spark of positivity, creativity, confidence and individuality that fuels you. So many of us used to be much Muchier. As adults, we often lose our Muchness. The day to day routines, the disappointments that sometimes seem like they’ll never end. We don’t take the time to see the joy. We forget to be inspired.

Hi, My name is Tova Gold and Finding My Muchness is a passion project I began as part of my healing journey after my identical twin girls were stillborn at 24 weeks due to Twin-to-Twin-Transfusion Syndrome.
Inviting joy back into my life in the form of sparkle and color on the outside ultimately helped me re-find the light, joy &
column2: confidence that I was missing on the inside. It's now my goal to help everyone find their MUCHNESS!

column1: The first step in finding your Muchness is tuning into your “Muchness Moments.” Those fleeting moments of joy, confidence, or happiness that so frequently get overlooked in the hectic stress filled moments of our lives.
I want to help you capture your Muchness Moments and start seeing the light again.
It's really important to create a tangible way to watch your Muchness Moments accumulate.
<ul>

•  Maybe you need a bit of direction looking for them, or a way to grasp the ‘feeling’ that comes over you when you are feeling connected to your Muchness. It’s that ‘feeling’ that is the key to finding your Muchness. After all, it’s hidden in those tiny moments.

• Maybe you know someone that could benefit from seeing the light filled moments that are surrounding them? Maybe they are going through a rough patch or seem trapped in grief or darkness? Maybe they’ve even said to you “I wish I knew how to stop feeling this way... I’m so tired of this anger, sadness, or feeling so disconnected.”
Feeling like that hurts. And it’s heavy. I know. It’s how I felt after our girls died. But I made the choice to break my destructive thought patterns and so can you.
The fact is, our thought patterns become habit and when we go through rough times, it can become HABIT to see everything through that lense.
I designed these cards to help you break the cycle and create a new habit.
<ul>
• One where you acknowledge your joyful moments.
• Where you congratulate yourself for a tiny moment of feeling empowered, or confident, or even silly.
• Where you celebrate the little accomplishments that will take you to the next step of healing and your own Muchness discovery!
What is the 30 Day Deck of Muchness Moments?
<div>

I've designed this deck of 30 small cards + a matching sticker all packaged in a beautiful drawstring bag. The fronts are filled with beautiful quotes, and on the backs contain simple little daily exercise prompts.
The prompts are designed to help you celebrate the tiny moments that make you feel GOOD. When you remember how that feels you can intentionally create MORE of those moments for yourself.
The fronts with their glittery quotes.
The backs with their thoughtful prompts.
***Check out the other perks below!***

The set of cards generally comes beautifully packaged in a velvet drawstring bag. If you are among the first 50 to snag the silk bag option, yours will arrive in a silk bag made from the same beautiful rich colors and fabrics used to make our popular Muchness Bands.

The included sticker goes on any jar in your home. After filling out your card with your Muchness Moment you slip it into the jar. As the days pass and you watch the cards accumulate you’ll be able to see a literal display of your Muchness Moments and how they’ve happened all around you, and how many blessings and strengths you really have.

If you make the commitment to fill out one card every day for 30 days, I guarantee you will feel different at the end of those 30 days. You will find yourself creating MuchnessMoments that simply didn’t exist before. You will feel lighter and less overwhelmed. You’ll feel a sense of gratitude for the blessings you do have, and compassion for those with less. You’ll feel more confident, more optimistic, and more capable of achieving the goals you want to set for yourself.
<h2>Perks &amp
Designed to inspire, Muchness Bands are our popular multi-functional accessory. Made of silk + sequins, these bands are meant to be a physical reminder to remember to see your Muchness Moments.
<div>• Meaningful colors = assorted sentiments &amp
• Inspirational quotes printed inside
• Secret pocket to store ""Love notes"" to yourself that you write on the enclosed Wish Strips.
__
<div>In my past life I created clever and fun handbags at a company I founded called Teeze Accessories &amp
column2: Stuff. I'm excited to be able to offer some of my favorite styles as perks with this campaign! Please note- These are all LIMITED EDITION and will never be made again, so grab them while you can!

column1: Designer Imposters Makeup Bag -
About 6"" tall in 4 colorways, this is a clear zippered pouch with a famous designer handbag printed on it. (Value $18)
<div>
Designer Imposters Tote Bag -
About 15"" tall in 4 colorways, this satin lined canvas tote bag is printed with a famous designer handbag on it. Includes multiple interior pockets and key clip. (Value $97)
Tighty Whiteeze Leather Purse-
Yup! It's a leather purse in either ""Tighty Whitee or ""Baby Got Black"". As seen on HGTV's Colorsplash. (Value $97)
What your purchase will do:
<div>

Helping you find your Muchness is my passion and I am a product designer by trade so you can only imagine the bajjilion Muchness Product ideas that pop into my head on a daily basis. But the fact is, I want to be sure I am making the products the YOU want. The ones you can see yourself using, engaging with, being inspired by and proudly giving as gifts to yur loved ones. And I believe this product does all of that. And, it's a product I CAN make. I have the resources all set up, I have the artwork all created and I just KNOW in my product designer gut that this is a beautiful, meaningful item that will inspire many to push through their darkness and re-find their light and Muchness. It is awesome as a gift, awesome for yourself, awesome as just a great, muchy reminder to cherish the little moments, the ones that help you tap into your own Muchness.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
I know that some of you may not be able to purchase a deck or monetarily support this campaign at this time. If that's the case I'd love your support in other ways!

Please help me get the word out and spraed this campaign via your social network, blog, FB, Twitter... It would mean SO MUCH if we an reach this goal together! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! They make it so easy to share!! You can also sign up on our FREE community site and start taking your own 30 Day MUCHNESS Challenge! Just by Getting IN TOUCH WITH THE MUCH you are doing a great thing for yourself and those you love!
ONE LAST THING!!!
I'm working on a second deck - one with a theme &
column2: twist I know you're gonna love! If we reach our fundraising goal by January 15th, I will go ahead and post the second deck as a stretch goal, meaning, by raising just a bit more $ I can offer BOTH decks! You're gonna love it. :)

column1: Do you think we can do it? I think we can do it!!

I just want to take a quick minute to thank you for reading, for your support and to all the people that have helped me bring The Muchness this far. Every single one of you means so much to me and I look forward to bringing you Much More Muchness in 2013!

xox, Tova

Short Summary
To whom it may concern,

I am Florian-Ayala Fauna, an artist, musician, poet, androgyne, and occult practitioner who has exhibited internationally in the UK and in Paris, France at the Centre Pompidou as well as having worked with members of Coil all at the age of 21.
This is an art campaign promoting a new aeon of thought, magick, art, and mysticism, Thee Æon Ov Baphomet.

The design was conceived after a conversation with the archangel Azrael during astral projection. Following this, many rituals, operations, projects, writings, etc. were conceived for which you can keep up to date with on my blog.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We will need the funding neccessary to bring about 500 patches, 500 posters, and 500 high-quality black shirts, all screen printed with white ink by professionals. You will get all of this as well as an additional 4-piece pin set for the first 100 who order.
<div>
The Impact

This project will hopefully be the first of many to revolutionize occult, artistic, fashion related communities around the globe. We need your help every step of the way to ensure this happens, for you will be part of the new aeon as well.
http://florian-ayala-fauna.tumblr.com/
You can keep up to date on this project and others in the above link or here.
Be sure to see my other campaigns as well.
Thank you.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can not contribute money to this project, please help us by spreading word through emails, chat rooms, communities, facebook, etc. for every little bit helps.","Short Summary
To whom it may concern,

I am Florian-Ayala Fauna, an artist, musician, poet, androgyne, and occult practitioner who has exhibited internationally in the UK and in Paris, France at the Centre Pompidou as well as having worked with members of Coil all at the age of 21.
This is an art campaign promoting a new aeon of thought, magick, art, and mysticism, Thee Æon Ov Baphomet.

The design was conceived after a conversation with the archangel Azrael during astral projection. Following this, many rituals, operations, projects, writings, etc. were conceived for which you can keep up to date with on my blog.
What We Need & What You Get

We will need the funding neccessary to bring about 500 patches, 500 posters, and 500 high-quality black shirts, all screen printed with white ink by professionals. You will get all of this as well as an additional 4-piece pin set for the first 100 who order.
The Impact

This project will hopefully be the first of many to revolutionize occult, artistic, fashion related communities around the globe. We need your help every step of the way to ensure this happens, for you will be part of the new aeon as well.
http://florian-ayala-fauna.tumblr.com/
You can keep up to date on this project and others in the above link or here.
Be sure to see my other campaigns as well.
Thank you.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can not contribute money to this project, please help us by spreading word through emails, chat rooms, communities, facebook, etc. for every little bit helps.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Buffalo, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/aeon-ov-baphomet/pica

The QuasimodoProject
What &
Quasimodo is a Charlotte, NC, network of creatives collaborating to ensure that the artistic pulse of Charlotte is seen and felt during the Democratic National Convention and thereafter.
It is a ground-up, non-political initiative, not tied to a single organization, but borne of the professional artists and designers themselves, with support from leading cultural institutions.
Our mission is to create, enable, and showcase the best, most innovative, challenging and accessible cultural offerings of the region during the DNC
column2: and, more importantly, to build a lasting platform for large-scale collaboration of the most capable Charlotte creatives and organizations well beyond the DNC.

column1: Our Vision

The Quasimodo Project was conceived in order for it to become a model for future collaboration within the Charlotte creative community, as a way of inspiring and realizing creative projects and making them accessible to all Charlotte citizens and visitors.

As a young and speedily growing city, Charlotte has an opportunity to develop it’s own cultural language in a way that is unusual compared to other cities- we get to essentially make up our own history in the arts. The Quasimodo Project aims to support the city of Charlotte as a shining center of growth in this country
column2: full of opportunities. The cultural aspect of a city reveals the personalities, strengths, and stories of a community, which we believe to be integral to Charlotte’s growth.  A progressive and sophisticated art presence not only affects the city’s humanitarian heartbeat, but also adds valuable cultural capital which financially pours back into the city.

column1: Who We Are
We are a broad range of professionals including artists, architects, dancers, industrial, graphic, &
column2: game designers, app developers, event planners, writers, theater directors, and cultural leaders.We are organized into three key groups:

column1: The Curators: Curating talent from all the fields of visual and performance art
The Creatives: Generating original creative works for the DNC week and beyond.
The Producers: Facilitating the Quasimodo effort and creating a lasting platform for long-term collaborative creative efforts in Charlotte.
Projects During the DNC
Curated Shows
column2: Live music of all genres, dance, theatre, poetry slam etc., along with art exhibitions and installations, will take place at a various venues throughout the downtown.

column1: Original Works: Specially created collaborative installations will be located at several sites in the Center City.
Mapping of Culture
column2: A map – both printed and online – that will link together all the cultural offerings and events.

column1: Why should you help:

We are attempting to create a new model for creating, sharing and experiencing art and creativity, where the artists are in lead, and have direct access to the public. And by doing that we are also making art free and accessible to the public, and be a part of your day to day experience in the streets and other public spaces.

column1: ","The story so far
I've been working on this project for most of the year 2011. As I progressed along I realised that I needed some help to launch the book.
What is it about
It's a collection of recent art based on the theme of archetypes. My own personal vision of very ancient themes.
The book will happen anyway, but...

I am aware of that I will not really earn anything for the long months I have invested in this but I really wanted it to be a high quality product. To achieve this I have appealed to several professionals, and of course I had and will have a lot of publicity expenses, especially since I plan to launch this at Eastercon in 2012 and I must finance this trip.
I will need to buy a small quantity of books (I am printing it on blurb.com) to offer on that occasion
I had the English text proof read by a professional, and it will be translated in French, both these bring more expenses
And last but not least I had a graphic designer design the final product.
All in all I need to raise 5'000$ to cover these expenses
And if you help you can get something nice in return
You can pledge anything from 5$, just to help me along. But depending on the sum you can pledge you may get a little gift in exchange.

You can of course just donate any sum and have my undying gratitude. But if you want one of the offered perks, you need to select this when you donate. Feel free to email me with questions: dr4gonlady@hotmail.com
Keep informed
You can follow the progress of the project by going to my Facebook page
Or following my blog
Disclaimer, there can't be any refunds (see the FAQ section)
Even if this campaign doesn't reach it's goal, the money given will be used.
Should it raise more than the goal, the rest will help for the French version of the book.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

My name is Dino and I am a fine artist, costume designer, and printmaker from Costa Rica. After graduating from MICA in Baltimore, I moved sight-unseen to New Orleans. I wanted to explore the culture, particularly the art of costuming and street parades. When one dresses in costume, one subverts the mundane. The ordinary is overturned when one explores oneself as an alternative persona/entity/figure through costume. When one dresses in costume, one enters a ritualistic space where alternative forms of self are allowed to surface. I strive to facilitate this discovery for others, helping them to find a sense of beauty through the act of changing clothes.

“Astral Glamour” is a multisexual (unrestrained by gender or sex) collection of pieces for the body. The collection seeks to transform everyday articles of clothing by infusing high-end fashion detailing and contemporary fiber art meshed with costume making and celebratory garish tendencies. I want the materials of Astral Glamour to be of the finest quality – particularly tulle and spandex – and also incorporate and transfigure everyday objects such as keys, googlie eyes, feathers, glitter, beads, and sequin appliques.

Contributors like you are vital to the launch of Astral Glamour because you are the ones who can help me fund the project. Your contributions will help me achieve my goal of helping people utilize costume as a fun medium to subvert the ordinary. I also hope the collection will highlight the notion that through wearing art you become art yourself.

The funds will be used for the following: fabric such as spandex, tulle, cotton and lace
column2: decorative miscellaneous objects such as keys, feathers, sequin appliques, and studs
column3:
and essentials such as thread, paint, elastic, polyester stuffing, and needles. For example, each pair of leggings requires around 3 to 4 yards of spandex fabric, sold on average from $8-$12 per yard – that’s $40 per legging for the material alone, before any design, collage work, or accessory materials are added. I am deeply committed to make this collection, and, with your help, I can challenge myself to bring this project to fruition.

Please check out the perks to see what suits your interests. All of the perks are hand-made by me. Feel free to check out my website for additional images of my work. Finally, if you are unable to donate to Astral Glamour, please share the project with your friends and other like-minded people that might be interested in supporting. Thank you very much!!!

Dino.
www.dinoreal.com

The goal for this project is to help fund my ArtPrize 2012 entry ""The Firebird"". ""The Firebird"" will be a metal sculpture of the legendary bird, a phoenix. When completed it will stand 11 feet tall and 10 feet wide. Everything will be hand made. Each feather will be cut, one at a time and worked into the perfect shape. My goal is to make the feathers out of stainless steel...but it's expensive...steel in general is expensive. 

That's why I need your help. I will need $2,100 to make this project happen. I'll need to purchase steel, lighting, and supplies. If I go over my goal, I'm going to try to put propane jets in the base of the sculpture to really light up the piece at night. I thank you in advance for any amount you choose to contribute. This piece is very special to me...because like a phoenix, I'm going through a rebirth of sorts in my personal life. 

I want ""The Firebird"" to stay nice and bright without the fear of rusting for a long, long time. I plan on putting flood lights in the base along its tail...just imagine how awesome it's going to look. All that light bouncing off the shiny stainless steel feathers...wow. 

Please consider funding this project. I have offered a variety of rewards for your donation. All my sculptures will be hand made, one-of-a-kind pieces of artwork...designed by your specifications. You let me know what you want and I'll build it. Thanks.

As residency artists at NARS-Foundation we have 3 month during
this summer to accomplish this community based art project. Our time is
limited. Until the end of September the work must be completed.
Unfortunately our professional videocamera broke down, and we
are lacking the budget for a short-term substitute. We have to purchase a new
device to be able to continue. We need it every single day.
Our project is asking:
What is the habitable city?
We are looking to find answers by those who have left the race
of time, those who don´t have anymore rivals, because they stand outside the
common values, outside the warily filled time.
For these project these are the elderly.
On the way to find answers we roam about the different boroughs
of Brooklyn, which are in the midst of gentrification, seeking for conversations
with the ones, who have lived in the neighborhoods for a very long time.
The fragments of those narrations are then assembled  with
processed film materiel to a spatial arrangement within the art space. Our
vision is to create an complex video work about the silent transformations of
personal territories.
We are no organization. We are only standing here and trying
out. If everything turns out fine, we will have in foreseeable time a space
filled with the images of the elder, their narrations about places, the
relicts, which are connected with forgotten stories and transitory gestures.
They make the city inhabitable.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
The Lost Words create typographic wall art using sustainable materials and hand made processes. We aim to inspire while supporting local charities.
We are a husband and wife team from Ocean Grove, Victoria, Australia who along with our studio manager Tylee (German Shepherd) are excited to be releasing our launch range here on Indiegogo.

Our launch range is comprised of 12 typographic, inspirational designs available as prints or laser engraved bamboo boards perfect for displaying on your wall. Our boards have a beautiful handfeel and are all produced from sustainably managed bamboo plantations by an FSC certified operator.

Ensuring our products are as good for the envirnoment as they are for our customers is key to us as is the ability to give back to the community as our brand builds. For this range we have partnered with a local charity called Ask! who support local individuals and families going through their breast cancer journey.

It is our hope that we can raise funds to help purchase all required equipment to be able to produce our products in house and make all our big ideas a reality in the future. Thanks in advance for your support! Kris, Lisa and Tylee.
Product Details - Wall Art Bamboo Boards

Our boards are hand cut to a size of 230 x 400 x 20mm or approx 9 x 16 x 0.75 inches. Boards are then hand sanded to a smooth finish and hand painted before being laser etched. All boards have a routed keyhole in the reverse side making hanging on your wall a simple process. All boards are posted securely in cardboard packaging.
Product Details - Wall Art Prints

Our prints are printed on 220gsm uncoated premium stock in either A3 or A4 size. A3 dimensions are 420mm x 297mm or approx 16 x 12 inches. A4 dimensions are 297mm x 210mm or approx 12 x 8 inches. All prints are posted securely in postal tubes.
What we need and what's in it for you
We are aiming to raise $5000 to help in the purchase of required equipment to be able to produce all our products in house.

We have a range of support options starting at $35 for a randomly selected A3 print  up to $1428 for a full set of 12 bamboo boards delivered anywhere in the world. Our boards are $120 each with no two boards being exactly the same due to the hand made process and natural fibres.
Please see below for a description of all options. If we are unable to reach our goal we will still produce all products for our supporters using other local businesses.
Our Hope
We feel that positive messages can have a significant effect on peoples lives and would be thrilled if our products can help our customers in a positive way.

The Lost Words comes from Kris's passion for typography and design where he has ten years experience in the industry combined with Lisa's passion for literacy and education being a primary teacher. We are proud to be able to combine our passions together into a product range that will positively benefit our customers.

We are also proud to be able to help local individuals and their families by partnering with Ask! We are looking to help many charities and organisations in the future as we work hard to build The Lost Words product range.
Other Ways You Can Help
<div>
Any support would be greatly appreciated, any donations under the $35 option will directly support our brand.
Financial support is not the only way to support The Lost Words, use the share tools here on Indiegogo to spread the word, tell a friend or follow us on Facebook, Twitter or Pinterest:
http://www.facebook.com/thelostwordsco
http://www.pinterest.com/thelostwordsco
http://twitter.com/thelostwordsco

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
An Artist Residency in Detroit, Michigan.
<ul>
• An English artist, painter, sculptor and photographer, doing first ever artist-in-residency!
• Engaging with Detroit and its people, looking for ways for artistic culture to improve Detroiters' lives. At Spread Art, Rosa Parks Blvd. from Nov 1st - 20th, 2016. Show on Nov 19th.
• An opportunity for an intensive work-spurt to take my art to the next level. AND a big experiment to work with young Detroiters to put on a socially engaged performance in just three weeks.

I am originally from London.  I'm looking forward to the inspiration of the big city, where new ideas are born, where change happens, and where culture is formed by thousands of different people in close proximity. Detroit is changing rapidly with a big art influx, but still has many problems. Detroiters are aware of the social divide in their city and the nation. My aim is to find ways toward closing that rift, both through my own work and through providing a platform for young Detroit talent.
To (almost) cover the cost, I will need $1,900
Breaking it down in more detail:
<ul>
• 3 week residency $450 + Utilities $50 = $500
• Paying performers something for work and expenses $400 (more, I hope!)
• Art Materials $400
<li>Printing 11”x 17” Flyposting &amp
• Driving 140 mile round trip twice bringing self and materials + equipment =$52
• Driving to venues (Galleries, museums, grocery stores, etc.) within greater Detroit $25
• Food (extra cost of) away from home: $10 X 21 days = $210
• Other expenses incl costumes/props for performance $95
• Fundraising (deductions by Indiegogo, credit card processing, publicizing etc.)  $158
• Total adds up to $1,900. Admittedly, it may cost a little more than this in total, but it's enough financially to make the residency a total success.
What is the world without art and culture?
Gadgets are fun and gizmos are handy, (or is it the other way around?) but without the arts how can we be human?
<ul>
• Culture is our strongest weapon in the struggle against violence, racism and inequality. Art and collaborative ventures amplify and create new social possibilities. Let's think big!
• This is my first chance to open up my ideas to new and bigger audience. It's an amazing opportunity to be in Detroit and build on the buzz of the rapidly changing city.

• I have over ten years of experience in working with Art and young people in the museum environment (plus with my own sons.)  I have organizational experience in co-running an art gallery (Dancing Dog Gallery, Ann Arbor) and running a local bi-annual Art Walk (Westside Art Hop.) This time, I will be free to promote and develop my own work, and have an uninterrupted three-week period to make a big project of visual art, music and performance.
<h3>Risks &amp

Three weeks is a short time to create a body of new work of my own, let alone gather some talented young people and create a performance work from scratch! But, a leap of faith (along with some steely determination and organizing skills) can wreak miracles. With your help.
<ul>
• Hey, if you are in Detroit and want to take part, or see the show, let me know!
• Here is the Detroit Spread Art website http://www.spreadart.org/ .
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Whether or not you can purchase a perk, you can still help enormously:
<ul>
<li>
Share the campaign widely, get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
• You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
• If you pick up your perk directly from the Artist, you'll be refunded the shipping cost.

Thanks, and I hope you enjoy browsing the rewards! (Pictures are under the video on the website version).

Featured: ""Softly in the Morning"" print $25 

Art mugs $18

Manga print $25

Calendar

Mermaid intaglio $50

Horses Running Free $960

  • All the perks are actual artworks made or designed by the artist!
  • Every bit helps. Thanks! 
","An Artist Residency in Detroit, Michigan.
An English artist, painter, sculptor and photographer, doing first ever artist-in-residency!
Engaging with Detroit and its people, looking for ways for artistic culture to improve Detroiters' lives. At Spread Art, Rosa Parks Blvd. from Nov 1st - 20th, 2016. Show on Nov 19th.
An opportunity for an intensive work-spurt to take my art to the next level. AND a big experiment to work with young Detroiters to put on a socially engaged performance in just three weeks.

I am originally from London.  I'm looking forward to the inspiration of the big city, where new ideas are born, where change happens, and where culture is formed by thousands of different people in close proximity. Detroit is changing rapidly with a big art influx, but still has many problems. Detroiters are aware of the social divide in their city and the nation. My aim is to find ways toward closing that rift, both through my own work and through providing a platform for young Detroit talent.
To (almost) cover the cost, I will need $1,900
Breaking it down in more detail:
3 week residency $450 + Utilities $50 = $500
Paying performers something for work and expenses $400 (more, I hope!)
Art Materials $400
Printing 11”x 17” Flyposting & Photocopying $60
Driving 140 mile round trip twice bringing self and materials + equipment =$52
Driving to venues (Galleries, museums, grocery stores, etc.) within greater Detroit $25
Food (extra cost of) away from home: $10 X 21 days = $210
Other expenses incl costumes/props for performance $95
Fundraising (deductions by Indiegogo, credit card processing, publicizing etc.)  $158
Total adds up to $1,900. Admittedly, it may cost a little more than this in total, but it's enough financially to make the residency a total success.
What is the world without art and culture?
Gadgets are fun and gizmos are handy, (or is it the other way around?) but without the arts how can we be human?
Culture is our strongest weapon in the struggle against violence, racism and inequality. Art and collaborative ventures amplify and create new social possibilities. Let's think big!
This is my first chance to open up my ideas to new and bigger audience. It's an amazing opportunity to be in Detroit and build on the buzz of the rapidly changing city.

I have over ten years of experience in working with Art and young people in the museum environment (plus with my own sons.)  I have organizational experience in co-running an art gallery (Dancing Dog Gallery, Ann Arbor) and running a local bi-annual Art Walk (Westside Art Hop.) This time, I will be free to promote and develop my own work, and have an uninterrupted three-week period to make a big project of visual art, music and performance.
Risks & Challenges

Three weeks is a short time to create a body of new work of my own, let alone gather some talented young people and create a performance work from scratch! But, a leap of faith (along with some steely determination and organizing skills) can wreak miracles. With your help.
Hey, if you are in Detroit and want to take part, or see the show, let me know!
Here is the Detroit Spread Art website http://www.spreadart.org/ .
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Whether or not you can purchase a perk, you can still help enormously:
Share the campaign widely, get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
If you pick up your perk directly from the Artist, you'll be refunded the shipping cost.

Thanks, and I hope you enjoy browsing the rewards! 0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Who I am

I have played music since I was a teenager, mostly with the aim to get up on stage and feel something special. I have been an insatiable music fan since I was four years-old. When my kids were born (now 15 and 12) I made a switch from rehearsing and performing with bands, to trying to record my own things in the basement -- keeping me more present for my young family and my wife.

As it turned out, what I wrote and recorded wasn't awful, especially given that I only really know how to play bass and drums. I worked hard to learn enough guitar, keys and production skills to make it sound proper -- with loads of great input from friends.
Where I am
I've already recorded my album. All new songs -- even though I have about 100, these 13 songs are almost all written and recorded since June.

The album is ready -- 16 and 24-bit masters and some for vinyl. I've registered them all and have all the coding and stuff taken care of. I'm still paying for the engineering, but I'm doing that myself.
What I need is $3,500 to get the album to press. 200 CDs will cost me $728 and 100 LPs will cost $2,500-$3,000.
Your help

If I can fund pressing this album, it will help me realise a long-time goal, perhaps lifetime goal. This is bucket list item #1. I've talked about this dream for many years. Money is my only obstacle.
No money?
Obviously, I get that or I wouldn't be here. Please share this pitch and maybe I can reach someone I would not have otherwise got to. That's just as good as funding.

<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column5: >The Spiva Sketchbook Project: Year One Community Launch

column1: Hi. My name is Josie Mai, and I am the new Executive Director of Spiva Center for the Arts in Joplin, Missouri. I love this place so much, I volunteered for 10 years before I got the job. While volunteering, I created exhibitions, curriculum, and programs for this 70-year old gem. George Spiva, founder, made his money by selling dynamite to the local miners turn of last century. Now I'm ready to blow our community's minds and hearts with the Spiva Sketchbook Project. Pun absolutely intended! 5 years ago, Joplin endured an EF5 tornado. Many lives were lost and almost a third of the city was leveled. Art in community has helped us heal, and this project is a next step toward creative recovery
column2:
a chance to write and draw new stories and histories.

There are two simple parts to the Project.

column1: Regional
artists are invited to a year-long sketchbook project. Interested artists
request a sketchbook, it is mailed to the artist, and the artist has one year
to fill the sketchbook. Sketchbook is mailed back to Spiva and then becomes the
property of Spiva Center for the Arts and is archived in the Rachel Salzer library where the
community may come view the books. Books will be digitized and made available
on the Spiva website. Prompts will be available on the website to encourage the
artists. In addition to the archive of sketchbooks, an exhibit will be mounted
featuring a range of two-page spreads. <b><i>The ultimate goal of Part 1 is to have
100 participating artists the first year creatively and concurrently
documenting their thoughts, interests, hopes, and dreams. These are then shared
locally through exhibition and globally via the web.
Part 2: Community-Wide Sketchbook
A series of monthly adult workshops
will be offered at Spiva. Participants receive a Sketchbook Starter Kit that
includes a sketchbook and various mark-making materials. They are encouraged to
come to each month’s offering and continue to work into the sketchbook included
in the kit. Artists enrolled in Part 1 can attend workshops for free. Others
need to invest $10 per session. Each month a new technique will be introduced.
Each workshop will be on the second Saturday of the month, noon-2pm, can hold
up to 20 participants, and will be facilitated by various local artists and
Spiva staff.  Participants will be
encouraged to attend monthly, but supplies for 40 participants will be
purchased to ensure at least 20 participants each month. There will be incentives
for regular attenders, such as a chance to exhibit or be published in a
collective book documenting the Spiva Sketchbook Project year.
The 12 Workshops
include Doodling, Collage, Writing Prompts, Mapping,
Printmaking, and much more. Workshops will take place at Spiva. A highly
successful Coloring Book Club, a partnership with Connect2Culture and the Post
Art Library, will be folded into the schedule of adult workshops.
In addition
to the adult workshops, there will be community outreach to 6th grade art

programs near Spiva: North Middle School and St Peter’s Junior High. The Tweens are often neglected, so this project is for them to be seen and heard! Facilitators will go out to these organizations once a month for the year and
teach the same workshops above. <b><i>The ultimate goal of Part 2 is
to engage the entire community in the concurrent creative documenting of their
thoughts, interests, hopes, and dreams, inside and outside of the art center.
Participants
will be surveyed at a few points during the year to get program feedback and a

sincere attempt to determine a fair participant cost in future years.

What We Need

column3: >Sketchbook Starter Kit for 40 adults, $50/kit

column2: >OVERFLOW when there are more participants than we thought we could reach! YAY! Let's add another $5000 for abundance and growth for the future!

column1: What You Get
$10 Glossy Sticker of a Sketchbook Participant's image
$20 Digital Print 11x14"" of an image
$50 Digital Print 11x14"" and a Glossy Sticker
$75
column2: >Chatbook of 60 different images https://chatbooks.com/

column1: $100 Large Tote Bag
$250 Large Tote Bag and Digital Print 11x14""
$500+ Name Dedication on the inside cover of an archived sketchbook

column2: >You may have seen other successful sketchbook projects, like the global Brooklyn Sketchbook Project. But this one, the Spiva Sketchbook Project, will make a direct, local, deep impact on the documented and shared creative output of a town of 50,000. Joplin is experiencing an artistic renaissance since the storm gave us a literal blank canvas to rebuild. Your donation will put sketchbooks in the hands of locals, artists and non-artists, to give them the chance to record our new story. Check this out:

column1: Believe me, I know what I'm getting you into! I know the difference you can make with your generous partnership with Joplin. Join us!
You can see my track record of successful art projects, programs, and exhibits at my website: http://www.josiemai.com/
Risks and Challenges

Hey, this is my first crowd-funding campaign. It could completely tank. It could be partially funded, and that's OK. I can trim the fat. We could also be swimming in abundance, and need to build a new art center to hold the hordes of budding, expressive artists in our region! There is nothing lost by putting a bold, innovative idea out to the masses.
Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give up the cash? Please help by sharing this campaign through social media. Pass it on immediately, as we have a 2-month window. If you have other brilliant ideas towards funding, please share them with me directly at jmai@spivaarts.org. Thank you for your time and consideration. Go make art!

will be surveyed at a few points during the year to get program feedback and a
sincere attempt to determine a fair participant cost in future years. What We Need

$2000 Sketchbook Starter Kit for 40 adults, $50/kit $1000 Supplies for 40 children $1000 Adult workshop facilitation $1000 Community outreach facilitation $10,000 Staff administration$2000 Scanner/technology$1000 Frames for exhibit $3000 Exhibit sponsorship $1000 Marketing/web $1000 Library remodel $1000 Book production $500 Mailing
OVERFLOW when there are more participants than we thought we could reach! YAY! Let's add another $5000 for abundance and growth for the future!
Total expenses:  $29,500
What You Get
$10 Glossy Sticker of a Sketchbook Participant's image
$20 Digital Print 11x14"" of an image
$50 Digital Print 11x14"" and a Glossy Sticker
$75 Chatbook of 60 different images https://chatbooks.com/
$100 Large Tote Bag
$250 Large Tote Bag and Digital Print 11x14""
$500+ Name Dedication on the inside cover of an archived sketchbook
The Impact

You may have seen other successful sketchbook projects, like the global Brooklyn Sketchbook Project. But this one, the Spiva Sketchbook Project, will make a direct, local, deep impact on the documented and shared creative output of a town of 50,000. Joplin is experiencing an artistic renaissance since the storm gave us a literal blank canvas to rebuild. Your donation will put sketchbooks in the hands of locals, artists and non-artists, to give them the chance to record our new story. Check this out: https://jrbj.biz/news/single/a-creative-renaiss...
Believe me, I know what I'm getting you into! I know the difference you can make with your generous partnership with Joplin. Join us!
You can see my track record of successful art projects, programs, and exhibits at my website: http://www.josiemai.com/
Risks and Challenges

Hey, this is my first crowd-funding campaign. It could completely tank. It could be partially funded, and that's OK. I can trim the fat. We could also be swimming in abundance, and need to build a new art center to hold the hordes of budding, expressive artists in our region! There is nothing lost by putting a bold, innovative idea out to the masses.
Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give up the cash? Please help by sharing this campaign through social media. Pass it on immediately, as we have a 2-month window. If you have other brilliant ideas towards funding, please share them with me directly at jmai@spivaarts.org. Thank you for your time and consideration. Go make art!",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hello!

My name is Winston Goertz-Giffen, I am an Oakland-based
recording engineer, musician, artist, and student dedicated to
encouraging the growth and sustainability of the varied arts and music
scenes in Oakland.  I am also interested in how these scenes can give

back to the communities of Oakland that foster them.

In
short, I am recording a music compilation album of Bay Area bands that I
am planning on releasing on cassette tape with a digital download code
(CDs are mostly obsolete, in my opinion, and tapes have that particular
je ne sais quoi) accompanied with a compiled selection of visual works
by artists from the Bay Area and elsewhere.  The title of the book is
Holding Opposites"", inspired by the philosophies of nondual wisdom, and
is going to feature two works each by the 30 selected artists

representing opposites or relationships in a creative way.

The
sales of the album and book are going to be a benefit for the local
non-profit SNAPS (Special Needs Activities ProfessionalS), whose aim is
to integrate the arts into the lives of neuro-diverse children and

adults.

I created a similar project in 2010, and I ended paying
close to $1000 out of pocket for duplication and printing costs, and I
am hoping with your contributions I will break even this time.  I am not
making money off of this project, any funds over my goal will simply go

towards creating more copies.

The project is going to be released
along with an art and music show featuring the contributing artists at
The Naming Gallery (335 15th St.) in downtown Oakland on August 7th with

a closing show on September 6.

The bill for August 7th is Two Gallants, B. Hamilton, Saything, and Spaceburn.

If
I do not reach my goal, I will just pay out of pocket.  I am interested
to see if this model is a sustainable approach towards creating art
while raising funds for  community support organizations.  If it works,

I will do it again!

Thanks! Here are a bunch of links to the contributing folks and other projects I am apart of-

GALLERY

www.naminggallery.com

BANDS (incomplete)

www.saything.net

www.bhamilton.bandcamp.com

www.hellobiplane.bandcamp.com

www.heatherjovanelli.bandcamp.com

www.brasilisaband.bandcamp.com

www.adamhstephens.com

ARTISTS (incomplete)

www.doyouknowbudsnow.com

www.peterstlawrence-art.com

www.jottodotcom.com

www.alexdoodles.com

www.zacharysethgreer.com

www.teddypancake.com

www.naamanrosen.com

www.marginalworks.com

Hi Everyone!

My name is Nicole Chan, a senior in high school, and I'm trying to publish my first magazine.

By definition, ""Limbo"" is a word used to describe a state of being undefined, which essentially what it's like to be a teenager.   We are stuck between being children and being adults, and are always given labels we didn't choose.  I wanted to create this magazine so that the personalities of the girls around me could be captured for what they truly are, rather than how others perceive them to be.  Through clothing and images I really hope that this can be achieved. 

The magazine has a features section, which will include articles, and an editorial section that contains the photographs.  

Each issue costs $50 to print so any donation would be really appreciated!  This is something I've been dreaming of doing since middle school and can't wait to share it with everyone.

Thank You!

NIKKI

Buenos días!
El equipo técnico y pedagógico,
venimos a pedir ayuda para financiar la compra de material para la
escuela EFA ABIDIN KAID SALEH DE LA RASD, es decir la escuela
de cine de los campamentos de refugiados Saharauis.
La escuela se formó hace 5 años con
la intención de crear un espacio para la gente joven, que es la que
más está sufriendo el abandono y el exilio, pues muchos ya han
terminado sus carreras universitarias y no todos encuentran un empleo
en los campamentos.
Acostumbrados a una vida de estudiantes
en capitales como Argel o la Habana, su situación es muy
delicada y difícil pues encuentran pocas oportunidades de ocio y
entretenimiento en los campamentos.
Hay jóvenes que no han cursado

estudios universitarios y necesitan otro tipo de ofertas educativas, por eso se han creado programas de formación profesional en los propios campamentos dónde introduce el cine, el vídeo y la televisión. Entre sus
oportunidades estamos fomentando el estudio de nuevas disciplinas que
muchos jóvenes pueden encontrar atractivas!
Estos refugiados vienen de un
mundo libre en el que era común disfrutar de una sala de cine
o de una obra de teatro, las condiciones les obligaron a preocuparse
de su supervivencia y sus necesidades básicas, la cultura ya se
entiende como una de ellas y por ellos proyectos como éste se hacen
cada vez más necesarios en poblaciones desfavorecidas.
Seis años después y tras el éxito de
las actividades de tipo didáctico desarrolladas en torno al <b>Festival
Internacional de Cine del Sahara, fundamentalmente talleres de
formación, se observa una fuerte demanda educativa entre la
población joven saharaui, demanda que propone a su vez el deseo de
establecer de manera continuada un Centro de Formación Audiovisual y
la necesidad de <b>preservar y difundir mediante la realización
audiovisual la idiosincrasia y el acervo cultural del pueblo
saharaui, el castellano como segunda lengua y la participación en
festivales de cine en los campamentos y en el extranjero.
Además, desde hace algunos años los
campamentos cuentan con un canal de televisión que demanda
profesionales.
Fruto de este deseo fue el inicio de la
construcción de la Escuela de Formación Audiovisual Abidin Kaid
Saleh de la RASD que inició sus clases en septiembre de 2010.
Con esta campaña queremos recaudar
dinero para comprar más material para la escuela.
Debido a los recortes que vivimos en
España a nivel estatal, el nivel de ayudas a disminuido
drásticamente, y nos encontramos en una situación dónde ahora más
que nunca, necesitamos recurrir a la ayuda del crowfunding para
incentivar un proyecto como éste.
- Porque creemos que es
necesario mejorar y incrementar el material que la escuela ya tiene.
-Para dar respuesta a la
demanda creciente de estudiar en la escuela por parte de los jóvenes
saharauis.
-Porque creemos en la escuela y
sabemos que este material será un elemento clave para la
profesionalización, tecnificación y mejora de los contenidos.
En caso de no conseguir los fondos,
estamos dispuestos a buscar financiación dónde sea necesario,
recurriendo a los métodos más tradicionales. Pero creemos que esta
es una forma de dar a conocer el proyecto y hacer a todo el mundo
partícipe de la escuela y su desarrollo.
Con este proyecto pedimos 2800 euros,
que irán destinados a:
-Ordenador: Ordenador potente que
permita a los alumnos, editar vídeos en full HD i si 	tenemos la
posibilidad en un futuro cercano de trabajar en 4k y RAW, etalonar y
retocar el 	color, trabajar con herramientas 3d y de posproducción
así como motion graphics, editar 	sonido, mezcla y mástering. Para
poder conseguir productos audiovisuales con una calidad 	óptima y
que se acerquen lo máximo posible a los estándares de calidad que
estan y estamos acostumbrados en el mercado audiovisual.
-Tarjeta de sonido: Para que los
alumnos puedan grabar con más calidad voces en off,	 	grabar su
propia musica si es necesario, mezclar y masterizar con más
fidelidad.
-Altavoces de respuesta plana:
Altavoces que permitan mezclar y masterizar con más 	precisión.De
esta forma tener mucho más control del sonido para acercarse más al
sonido de 	los espacios dónde se puedan ver en un futuro los
largometrajes o cortometrajes.
-Micrófono de condensador: Para poder
grabar sus propias canciones, cantantes, voces en of, 	doblajes,
etc...
-Teclado controlador MIDI: Para
producir su propia música o bases sonoras para conseguir 	un diseño
de sonido más acurado.
-Monitores: Monitores LCD que
permitirán ser más efectivos en el retoque de color, edición,
postproducción etc...
Somos conscientes de la situación
económica que se vive en España y sabemos lo necesaria que es la
ayuda para muchas familias y ONG's que actúan en el ámbito
nacional. A pesar de esto, nos vemos obligados a pedir ayuda siendo
conscientes también de la situación de exilio y refugio en que vive
el pueblo Saharaui. Entendemos también que el cine no es una
necesidad vital o de primera instancia, pero creemos que el arte, ha
ayudado y ayudará a los jóvenes a canalizar sus emociones, a crear
un nuevo espacio pedagógico y creativo para que los jóvenes salgan
de sus rutinas y puedan expresarse creativamente.
Una vez recaudado el dinero, haremos un
seguimiento diario de su compra, su envío a los campamentos y su uso
académico en la escuela. Los alumnos harán sus propios videos para
que los que hayáis financiado el proyecto, podáis conocer al <b>100% y
de forma transparente, el uso de este dinero y material.
Para entender el contexto.
El 14 de noviembre de 1975, se firmaron
en Madrid los Acuerdos Tripartitos por los cuales los españoles
entregaban el Sáhara Occidental a Marruecos y Mauritania. A cambio
de compensaciones económicas y políticas, España abandonó a su
suerte al Pueblo Saharaui. Considerada hasta ese momento como una
provincia española más, el Sahara Occidental es invadido por el
norte por Marruecos con la conocida “marcha verde” y por el sur
por Mauritania que cuatro años después abandonaría la ocupación
reconociendo el derecho del Pueblo Saharaui a su propio territorio.
Desde aquel fatídico año se inició
el éxodo saharaui: han pasado por la frontera entre el Sahara
Occidental y Argelia miles de hombres y mujeres saharauis que han
abandonado su tierra ante la invasión y consecuente represión
marroquí. Los que consiguieron atravesar este desierto se instalaron
en la hammada argelina de la región de Tinduf, “el desierto del
desierto”. A la escasez de agua, luz eléctrica y alimentos se
suman las difíciles condiciones climáticas que tienen que soportar.
Los refugiados saharauis instalaron allí sus jaimas y día a día
han ido organizando sus campamentos conjuntamente con la ayuda

internacional.

Sólo nos queda daros las gracias por parte del equipo de la escuela y agradeceros con total sinceridad que hayáis destinado unos minutos a leer sobre este proyecto tan interesante.


","Buenos días!
El equipo técnico y pedagógico,
venimos a pedir ayuda para financiar la compra de material para la
escuela EFA ABIDIN KAID SALEH DE LA RASD, es decir la escuela
de cine de los campamentos de refugiados Saharauis.
La escuela se formó hace 5 años con
la intención de crear un espacio para la gente joven, que es la que
más está sufriendo el abandono y el exilio, pues muchos ya han
terminado sus carreras universitarias y no todos encuentran un empleo
en los campamentos.
Acostumbrados a una vida de estudiantes
en capitales como Argel o la Habana, su situación es muy
delicada y difícil pues encuentran pocas oportunidades de ocio y
entretenimiento en los campamentos.
Hay jóvenes que no han cursado

estudios universitarios y necesitan otro tipo de ofertas educativas, por eso se han creado programas de formación profesional en los propios campamentos dónde introduce el cine, el vídeo y la televisión. Entre sus
oportunidades estamos fomentando el estudio de nuevas disciplinas que
muchos jóvenes pueden encontrar atractivas!
Estos refugiados vienen de un
mundo libre en el que era común disfrutar de una sala de cine
o de una obra de teatro, las condiciones les obligaron a preocuparse
de su supervivencia y sus necesidades básicas, la cultura ya se
entiende como una de ellas y por ellos proyectos como éste se hacen
cada vez más necesarios en poblaciones desfavorecidas.
Seis años después y tras el éxito de
las actividades de tipo didáctico desarrolladas en torno al Festival
Internacional de Cine del Sahara, fundamentalmente talleres de
formación, se observa una fuerte demanda educativa entre la
población joven saharaui, demanda que propone a su vez el deseo de
establecer de manera continuada un Centro de Formación Audiovisual y
la necesidad de preservar y difundir mediante la realización
audiovisual la idiosincrasia y el acervo cultural del pueblo
saharaui, el castellano como segunda lengua y la participación en
festivales de cine en los campamentos y en el extranjero.
Además, desde hace algunos años los
campamentos cuentan con un canal de televisión que demanda
profesionales.
Fruto de este deseo fue el inicio de la
construcción de la Escuela de Formación Audiovisual Abidin Kaid
Saleh de la RASD que inició sus clases en septiembre de 2010.
Con esta campaña queremos recaudar
dinero para comprar más material para la escuela.
Debido a los recortes que vivimos en
España a nivel estatal, el nivel de ayudas a disminuido
drásticamente, y nos encontramos en una situación dónde ahora más
que nunca, necesitamos recurrir a la ayuda del crowfunding para
incentivar un proyecto como éste.
- Porque creemos que es
necesario mejorar y incrementar el material que la escuela ya tiene.
-Para dar respuesta a la
demanda creciente de estudiar en la escuela por parte de los jóvenes
saharauis.
-Porque creemos en la escuela y
sabemos que este material será un elemento clave para la
profesionalización, tecnificación y mejora de los contenidos.
En caso de no conseguir los fondos,
estamos dispuestos a buscar financiación dónde sea necesario,
recurriendo a los métodos más tradicionales. Pero creemos que esta
es una forma de dar a conocer el proyecto y hacer a todo el mundo
partícipe de la escuela y su desarrollo.
Con este proyecto pedimos 2800 euros,
que irán destinados a:
-Ordenador: Ordenador potente que
permita a los alumnos, editar vídeos en full HD i si 	tenemos la
posibilidad en un futuro cercano de trabajar en 4k y RAW, etalonar y
retocar el 	color, trabajar con herramientas 3d y de posproducción
así como motion graphics, editar 	sonido, mezcla y mástering. Para
poder conseguir productos audiovisuales con una calidad 	óptima y
que se acerquen lo máximo posible a los estándares de calidad que
estan y estamos 	acostumbrados en el mercado audiovisual.
-Tarjeta de sonido:  Para que los
alumnos puedan grabar con más calidad voces en off,	 	grabar su
propia musica si es necesario, mezclar y masterizar con más
fidelidad.
-Altavoces de respuesta plana:
Altavoces que permitan mezclar y masterizar con más 	precisión.De
esta forma tener mucho más control del sonido para acercarse más al
sonido de 	los espacios dónde se puedan ver en un futuro los
largometrajes o cortometrajes.
-Micrófono de condensador: Para poder
grabar sus propias canciones, cantantes, voces en of, 	doblajes,
etc...
-Teclado controlador MIDI: Para
producir su propia música o bases sonoras para conseguir 	un diseño
de sonido más acurado.
-Monitores: Monitores LCD que
permitirán ser más efectivos en el retoque de color, edición,
postproducción etc...
Somos conscientes de la situación
económica que se vive en España y sabemos lo necesaria que es la
ayuda para muchas familias y ONG's que actúan en el ámbito
nacional. A pesar de esto, nos vemos obligados a pedir ayuda siendo

About Me and BAPS JAPON

My name is Nikita Bitch Project, a Japanese burlesque performer and English-Japanese translator based in Los Angeles. I have teamed up with BAPS JAPON, the Japan's first and only website featuring burlesque and pinup scenes both in and outside of Japan. So far we have introduced many burlesque performers and pinup models, produced burlesque shows and pinup events, collaborated with a educational burlesque convention, premiered indie movies such as The Burlesque Assassins and It's All That Gilitters, and published BAPS zine, the Japan's first-ever magazine about Japanese and international scenes of burlesque and pinup. Since we have no sponsors, all of these activities have been simply done by passion of Toy, the founder of BAPS JAPON, volunteers and myself who all believe in these cultures and wish the community grow in Japan.

Now BAPS JAPON is having the 5th anniversary. As a celebration, we are working very hard to make our dream projects happen. The Japan premiere of the award-winning documentary film about the pinup icon Bettie Page, Bettie Page Reveals All, and the biggest burlesque showcase in the Japanese modern burlesque history, Burlesk-O-Futurama.

BAPS JAPON 5th Anniversary

We have two big events to celebrate our 5th anniversary:
Japan premiere of Bettie Page Reveals All on May 9th &
<ul>
• After almost three years of discussion with the Academy nominated director Mark Mori, we finally came to an agreement of the Japan premiere in a beautiful private theater in Tokyo, Espase Images.

• The movie will be screened with Japanese subtitles translated by Nikita Bitch Project.
  • A special talk session with Japanese art and fashion gurus: Rockin' Jelly Bean (artist) and Nobuhiko Kitamura (designer and founder of HYSTERIC GLAMOUR.)
The Japan's biggest burlesque showcase, Burlesk-O-Futurama, on May 16th at Tokyo Kinema Club
<ul>
• Having the world-renown burlesque star, Ms. Erochica Bamboo (Miss Exotic World 2003) as our headliner, this will sure be the most spectacular burlesque show ever in Japan.
• With a lot of international leading figures in burlesque such as Cherry Typhoon and Murasaki Babydoll, we also have many variety performers to represent the Japanese scene.
• At Tokyo Kinema Club, the historical grand cabaret with more than 40-year history.
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2:
What You GetTo produce such huge-scale events, we need to secure the budget for venues, promotions, fees for professionals (performers, stage staff, guests, etc.) But more importantly, we have to make this a big success to expand the possibility of Japanese burlesque and pinup scene so that we can hopefully hold a more international festival in the near future. This is our biggest challenge to represent our community.
So we decided to sell the newest issue of our magazine, BAPS zine exclusively here on Indiegogo. Since the launch in last October, our zine has gained an incredible amount of great feedback and inquiries throughout the US. The new issue that is going to be released in May will feature special interview with Mark Mori, Coco Lectric who had her first Japan tour, an autobiography by Erochica Bamboo, and so many interesting articles! (The zine is written in both in Japanese and English.) This could be your only chance to purchase the BAPS zine as the last issue was sold out right after the launch and we're expecting the same for this coming issue as well. So please don't wait and get your copy before it's gone! It'll also be a great help for the Japanese scene to grow!

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

As a burlesque performer, I totally understand that your budget is always tight. Even if it'd be difficult for you to financially support us, I really appreciate your share of this Indiegogo project and let your friends and community know about us. And if you are currently living in Japan or planning to visit Tokyo during those dates, please consider purchasing tickets via Peatix that our Japan team is running now:
May 9th &
column2: 10th, Japan Premiere of Bettie Page Reveals All: <a href=""http://peatix.com/event/87260"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif

column1: May 16th, Burlesk-O-Futurama:

My original amount for this campaign was $20,000. Since my show is now at the Salon Residency at the Canal Place  on Canal Street my costs  have been extremely reduced to now $3000 USD.
Short Summary
Hi my name is D. Lammie-Hanson and I am a silverpoint artist. I am the only female artist of color who creates contemporary portraits in silver in the New Orleans area.

I am creating a new series of silverpoint portraits called ""Dared To Be..."" which is art made primarily in silver to celebrate Essence Fest 25th Anniversary in New Orleans this year.  Silver is the precious metal that represents the 25 year anniversary.  And since my medium is silver, I am a woman of color and I live in New Orleans, I couldn't think of a better opportunity than have a show of artwork in silver to celebrate this fact.
<h3>What We Need &amp
The Break Down:
<ul>
<li>My materials of silver wires of gauges of 12 ga., 14 ga., 16 ga., and 18 ga. plus wood, canvas, paper and framing
<li>Production costs (Executing Skill and Time required to complete 25 silverpoint pieces
• Hanging art and special lighting costs
• Opening reception costs
• Production of Book/Catalog for the show costs
• Art Insurance costs
<li>The perks are<ul>
• $10 - 35 my utmost appreciation and gratitude
• $40 - 1 Signed and Numbered Limited Edition Print* 4 in x 6 in matted to 8 in x 10 in,
• $75 - 2 Signed and Numbered Limited Edition Prints** 4 in x 6 in matted to 8 in x 10 in
<li>$100 - 1 Signed &amp
column2: Numbered Print* and Autographed Book of Show

column1: <li>$150 - 2 Signed &amp
column2: Numbered Print** and Autographed Book of Show

column1: • $200 - 1 small artwork painting (not silverpoint)
• $500 - 1 medium sized artwork (not silverpoint)
•  $1000 - a selected silverpoint artwork (to be either from the Dared To Be... show or Barna Black series)
The Impact
The major difference your contribution will make:
<ul>
• This project is valuable because this art represents the amazing spirit we all have. It helps me as an artist to communicate to the world that we, people of color, can shine.
• I've shown my first series during woman's history month and the artist's talk inspired the audience to take a good look at themselves and find their own inner light.
• Art made of likeness of people who continuously dare to live their best positive authentic lives helps many souls
<h3>Risks &amp

• I am a full time artist who loves what she does. The risk is this is my project and chose not to accept any commissions during this production period so that I can dedicated the valuable time to create this work.  I am working side jobs to pay for my expenses which cuts dramatically into my production time. Your donation will help me to cut back on the side jobs to creating artwork.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute at this time or attend the show, this is how you can help:
<ul>
• Please share this your campaign with your friends, posse, family, bosses and co-workers .
• Send me your email and I will send you the newsletter for the event.

Short Summary

As film, anime, and gun nerds, we're a small group of people looking to combine the action and aesthetics of anime, along with the weapons and tactics of the real world in short, entertaining videos.

We're hoping that this synergy will create something truly unique and beautiful! 

Raifu-01 was originally conceived as a mascot character inspired by the first models for Weapon Outfitters, all fiery and capable redheaded women skilled with weapons.  Artist Paigeosity designed her, then a team of superfans from LA created an instagram account to bring her to life.

It turned out they are also talented filmmakers, and we've partnered up with them officially in order to bring Raifu-01 and the rest of the WO anime girls to life with some live action videos!
<h3>What We Need &amp

In order to bring the adventures of Raifu-01 and company to life in a manner that's worth your support and time, we need to raise a budget. Your financial assistance will allow us to:

- Rent professional film equipment (we already have all the firearms! ^_^)
- Professional scripting
- Real world weapons and tactics consulting from experienced professionals
- Transportation and logistics
- Handle production costs such as SFX, stunts, editing and original music to make it super badass

- Create more awesome swag and stickers / patches based on our characters

Our goal is definitely QUALITY over quantity so scripting, actors, production, and post production will all be professional grade, just like our preview video/intro!

We're hoping to make multiple videos, but depending on how much funding we are able to crowdsource, we will adjust length and quantity of videos accordingly! The team has decided that every single dollar over campaign goals will be saved and put into the NEXT video!

To thank you for your support, we will be offering multiple tiers, from fan level perks with swag and merchandise, all the way up to producer perks!

Roy and Jaxon at WO, along with our many friends and acquaintances with and relevant weapons will be volunteering our time, expertise, equipment and weapons to support the campaign, but we are definitely not going to asking the actors and professionals working on this to work for free!  

We at WO won't take a dime, and in the spirit of transparency, here is where all the money is going!
The Impact
Our team is super passionate about anime and firearms, and we believe we're making a difference in showing that tactical weebery can be portrayed in a positive and entertaining light!
<h3>Risks &amp
Film projects are very expensive and time consuming. Thankfully, with your help and support, we are confident our experienced and talented team will get amazing work done!
Other Ways You Can Help
Help us get the word out! Share our campaign on your social media, and follow Raifu-01 on instagram if you haven't already!
Meet The Team

Weapon Outfitters has been a leading name in the high-end firearms accessories business for over a decade and has an affinity for supporting and merging the arts with weapon-culture.  From pursuing creative endeavors and unique photo shoots, to even backing independent film projects, Weapon Outfitters is excited to bring to life the art that represents the company. As the front line of weapons, women, and especially weebery, this project is sure to be an epic display of awesome content!

Paigeosity is an artistic powerhouse and has been developing a line of original merch and character art for Weapon Outfitters.  As an enthusiast for all things video game, anime, and especially gun-related, she naturally encapsulates the creative vision of the company. As the one who brought life and passion to each of her characters, she is elated to see them come to life in this original project!
Visit her site PAIGEOSITY.COM and follow her on IG!

Leo Kei Angelos is a stuntman, film director and firearms instructor. He loves all things tactical, geekery and gaming. He is super excited to work with the Weapon Outfitters team to create badass anime-inspired live action films featuring modern, realistic tactics &
Follow him @leokeiangelos on Instagram and YouTube.

Juliette Sureau is a French American filmmaker, model, gamer, adventurer, and all around nerd.  She is very excited about working with the wonderful team at Weapon Outfitters and is very thankful Paigeosity’s character Raifu looks nearly exactly like her ^_^
You can follow her @juliettesureau on Instagram.
","Short Summary

As film, anime, and gun nerds, we're a small group of people looking to combine the action and aesthetics of anime, along with the weapons and tactics of the real world in short, entertaining videos.We're hoping that this synergy will create something truly unique and beautiful! Raifu-01 was originally conceived as a mascot character inspired by the first models for Weapon Outfitters, all fiery and capable redheaded women skilled with weapons.  Artist Paigeosity designed her, then a team of superfans from LA created an instagram account to bring her to life.It turned out they are also talented filmmakers, and we've partnered up with them officially in order to bring Raifu-01 and the rest of the WO anime girls to life with some live action videos!
What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring the adventures of Raifu-01 and company to life in a manner that's worth your support and time, we need to raise a budget. Your financial assistance will allow us to:- Rent professional film equipment (we already have all the firearms! ^_^)
- Professional scripting
- Real world weapons and tactics consulting from experienced professionals
- Transportation and logistics
- Handle production costs such as SFX, stunts, editing and original music to make it super badass

- Create more awesome swag and stickers / patches based on our charactersOur goal is definitely QUALITY over quantity so scripting, actors, production, and post production will all be professional grade, just like our preview video/intro!We're hoping to make multiple videos, but depending on how much funding we are able to crowdsource, we will adjust length and quantity of videos accordingly! The team has decided that every single dollar over campaign goals will be saved and put into the NEXT video!To thank you for your support, we will be offering multiple tiers, from fan level perks with swag and merchandise, all the way up to producer perks!Roy and Jaxon at WO, along with our many friends and acquaintances with and relevant weapons will be volunteering our time, expertise, equipment and weapons to support the campaign, but we are definitely not going to asking the actors and professionals working on this to work for free!  We at WO won't take a dime, and in the spirit of transparency, here is where all the money is going!
The Impact
Our team is super passionate about anime and firearms, and we believe we're making a difference in showing that tactical weebery can be portrayed in a positive and entertaining light!
Risks & Challenges
Film projects are very expensive and time consuming. Thankfully, with your help and support, we are confident our experienced and talented team will get amazing work done!
Other Ways You Can Help
Help us get the word out! Share our campaign on your social media, and follow Raifu-01 on instagram if you haven't already!
Meet The Team

Weapon Outfitters has been a leading name in the high-end firearms accessories business for over a decade and has an affinity for supporting and merging the arts with weapon-culture.  From pursuing creative endeavors and unique photo shoots, to even backing independent film projects, Weapon Outfitters is excited to bring to life the art that represents the company. As the front line of weapons, women, and especially weebery, this project is sure to be an epic display of awesome content!

Paigeosity is an artistic powerhouse and has been developing a line of original merch and character art for Weapon Outfitters.  As an enthusiast for all things video game, anime, and especially gun-related, she naturally encapsulates the creative vision of the company. As the one who brought life and passion to each of her characters, she is elated to see them come to life in this original project!
Visit her site PAIGEOSITY.COM and follow her on IG!

Leo Kei Angelos is a stuntman, film director and firearms instructor. He loves all things tactical, geekery and gaming. He is super excited to work with the Weapon Outfitters team to create badass anime-inspired live action films featuring modern, realistic tactics & weapons.
Follow him @leokeiangelos on Instagram and YouTube.

Juliette Sureau is a French American filmmaker, model, gamer, adventurer, and all around nerd.  She is very excited about working with the wonderful team at Weapon Outfitters and is very thankful Paigeosity’s character Raifu looks nearly exactly like her ^_^
You can follow her @juliettesureau on Instagram.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
