1. WHAT IS CAPOEIRA?

Capoeira is an Afro-Brazilian form of martial art/dance engaged in at clubs, schools and on the streets. A sport involving intense physical training, it incorporates music, dance and combative movements, fascinating in beauty and form. The game takes place in a roda (circle) formed by the students and involves two players who try to outwit each other through a physical dialog using a combination of kicks, takedowns, escapes and acrobatics, which are wonderfully fluid in appearance.

There are no hard and fast rules, yet capoeira does follow a characteristic protocol, along with having its own music – perhaps its most enduring feature. Through learning the songs of capoeira, students also gain access to learning a new language (Portuguese), instruments and Brazilian history. By binding together these elements of sport, music, dance, martial skills and camaraderie, capoeira comprises one of the richest manifestations of Brazilian culture.
1.1 WHO ARE WE?

We are the Westchester County chapter of the capoeira group Cordão de Ouro. Professor Cabeção, who has been practicing for 16 years under the supervision of Mestre Esquilo, has been offering classes in Tarrytown and Ossining since January 2012. This will be the first batizado for Professor Cabeção’s group in the area.
2. WHAT IS A BATIZADO?

A capoeira batizado is an event that brings capoeiristas from all over the world together with other athletes, fans of sports, art and music, along with friends and family of the local group members to participate in and enjoy workshops, performances and celebrations organized with the intention of promoting capoeira, as well as all elements of music, culture, health, dance and the arts in the area. The purpose of the batizado ceremony is to deliver the first cord (the equivalent of a belt in other martial arts) to the students of the local group. In order to perform this ceremony, the presence of a capoeira Mestre is essential. Numerous capoeira professionals are called to assist in the organization of the ceremony (to play instruments, sing, graduate the students, etc.). The students are involved not only in promoting capoeira and demonstrating what they have learned over the course of their training for the capoeira community, friends and family, but also in elevating the name and image of the city and surrounding areas through capoeira. We also see this event as an opportunity to stimulate activity in the area and bring residents more art, culture, entertainment, health, music and everything associated with capoeira. With each event we grow, both individually and as a group, and improve the quality of our own capoeira and the quality of our local capoeira group.
3. TENTATIVE EVENT SCHEDULE
Thursday October 18, 2012
7:30 - 9 pm Capoeira Workshop &
Friday October 19, 2012
7 - 9 pm Capoeira Workshop &
Saturday, October 20, 2012
1 – 3 pm Capoeira Workshops
3 - 7 pm Performances, Batizado &
8 pm Brazilian Party with Dance Workshop
4. OBJECTIVE

We are promoting an event with our students in order to celebrate our work in the area and to bring capoeira practitioners, friends, family and the public to join us in celebration, to enjoy entertainment and culture, and to share our enthusiasm for our existence as a group. We intend to publicize our work related to capoeira, culture, education, and health, along with the work of others in the area who share these values. We are working to bring two people who are recognized and valued in the capoeira community for their importance and talent, in order to enhance the event and attract more practitioners and the community to come to learn more about capoeira, participate in the proposed activities, and ultimately to mobilize more people and to bring an exceptional quality to the information and activities to be presented at the event.

Please contact us if you would like more information regarding our proposal to bring Contra-Mestre Eurico. Eurico Vianna is working on a PhD in Sociology at Griffith University in Australia and has been a junior level master of capoeira since 2004. Throughout his career in capoeira and his academic studies he has given numerous lectures, written articles and a book, participated in documentaries and international projects involving the use of capoeira as a tool for social inclusion. He would like to come to help us with our event, and has offered to give lectures or workshops at other locations in the area to cover his travel expenses.
5. JUSTIFICATION

This event is essential in order to reward the efforts of the students who have been training and preparing to graduate, and through a great ceremony or event, to celebrate while bringing different activities such as capoeira to the area. The event will encourage others in the area with similar work and ideals to come together, and magnify the name and image of the city and locale through capoeira, thus allowing us to develop resources that will aid in our growth, to satisfy the public, and to always be able to bring entertainment, culture, art, health and quality to the area, and to be able to disseminate and develop projects here similar to various projects that already exist in Brazil.
6. SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES
There are numerous ways to become involved and show support for our event. Below is a list of our needs and estimated expenses.
$3,000 – travel expenses (flight, housing, food, etc.) for Mestre Esquilo and Contra-Mestre Eurico
$1,000 – instructors’ fees for workshops ($200 per workshop, 5 workshops)
$1,000 – rent for event &
column2: party locations / or donate your space

column1: $700 – for approximately 180 t-shirts (2 colors, front and back)
$200 – marketing material (posters, flyers, signs)
$100 – other expenses (yarn to make the cords, water for participants at the event, etc.)
We are classifying our donors into three categories:
<ol>

• Sponsors – those who donate more than $250 will have the option to provide us with a name to include on all of our marketing materials (posters, flyers, signs, etc.), which we will distribute and post in the surrounding areas and on the internet. Additionally, sponsors can send us a logo (1 color only) to be printed on the back of the event t-shirt. Sponsors will of course be acknowledged at the event, and are welcome to attend the event free of charge.
<ol>

• Supporters – those who give $100-250 will have the option to provide us with a name to include on all of our marketing materials (posters, flyers, signs, etc.), which we will distribute and post in the surrounding areas and on the internet. Supporters will also be acknowledged at the event, and are welcome to attend the event free of charge.
<ol>

• Friends – those who would like to contribute any amount but have no intention of promoting anything. Friends seek to assist the group in the promotion of our event, and to support activities such as those we are proposing. This can be done anonymously or not, and in those cases that are not anonymous it will be our pleasure to do an homage on the day of the event.

We are open to discussing any other arrangements (i.e. donating food, space, t-shirts, marketing material, etc.) that would assist in the organization of our event. Anyone who would be interested in setting up a table at the event to sell or advertise products/services to participants and event guests should contact us.

The crowd-curated Social Arts Market for artists and enthusiasts - revolutionising the art market.

We believe there is a better and simpler way to exhibit and collect art. We are creating a global community of artists and art enthusiasts who will discover, exhibit, curate, buy and connect through our online platform:
Project Art.
To build this community and create a level playing field for artists and those interested in art, we need you help. Pledge now and help us revolutionise the arts market.
The problem

column4: >""<i>As art enthusiasts we found that it is more difficult to start buying and collecting art than it needs to be. At the

column1: same time a wealth of talented artists find it hard to break into a market that is heavily pre-curated and
exclusive.

column4: ><i>To challenge the traditional model of the art market we created Project Art, providing artists and art enthusiasts

column1: worldwide with a crowd-curated platform. By engaging everyone, we shape community-driven trends and
increase the range and variety of artworks available.”
Our solution

The Project Art platform provides an environment that showcases the work of a wide range of emerging as well as established artists. It facilitates the connection between artists, art enthusiasts and collectors cultivating
an online community built around original forms of fine art.
So much more than an online gallery, Project Art is an immersive, social and creative online experience. Some of the key features of the platform will be:
Even if you do not know exactly what it is you are looking for, the search engine helps you to find the right art.
You can even upload picture files of art you like. The engine will then look for similar works across the platform and present you with suggestions.
Artwork Profile
When you have found an artwork that you like, you can have a look at the artwork profile.
Here you can find realtime trends and a fluctuating value of the work based on activities, interactions and purchase trends. In addition, reviews will help you to determine the popularity of a work.
The “view-in-room” feature lets you see how an artwork would fit in your living room, workplace or gallery, giving you a better sense of the work before you buy it.
Every artwork profile comes with detailed information about the artist and the piece, and all information can be shared with others.
Virtual Collection
When you have found one or more pieces that you like, you can add them to your very own virtual collection. Additionally, you can share what you like with others.
The Platform for Artists

As an artist the platform makes your art discoverable to an entirely new community of enthusiasts, collectors and other artists. The platform offers multiple opportunities to expose your work to a live audience, through
events, competitions and awards.
The platform helps artists break through the barriers to the arts market and share your work to a wide and engaged audience.
The Impact
Imagine a broad community of artists from all corners of the world, whose work is accessible to everyone to discover on one platform.

Currently, there are a lot of white walls out there. By empowering artists to exhibit their work and empowering enthusiasts to find the art that suits them, we will fill those walls with original art from trending artists globally.

We are already engaging 900+ artists and we are continuously adding to our fast growing community. Your investment will help us to grow even faster and build the technology that enables us to deliver our vision.
<h3>What We Need &amp
With your support we can develop and grow our platform, making it accessible to anyone, anywhere, anytime.
Your support will fund:
An online platform
Your support will help us to continue the development of the platform and build the social and experiential features which make this platform so unique.

column4: >""<i>Showcasing my work online is essential these days. As an artist I need a platform where my work is well presented and

column1: people can easily find it and really engage with it. I want to be part of emerging trends and I want to see my artwork gain
popularity."" - Alexandra Ileana Constantine, Artist
Awareness

With your help we can raise awareness, engage our community and grow our customer base, all around the world. By doing this we can open up the arts market to many more people and support even more artists.
Your support will get you:
A Badge
Whatever your investment, you will always get a “Contributor to the Arts” badge added to your profile on our platform when you register.
Other Perks

Artists are just as excited about our project as we are and they are providing some of their artwork and creativity in return for your investment. Each reward is a unique package for you to chose from, designed to help promote our artists early on. By contributing you can support us, support artists and reward yourself.
More Ways You Can Help
During the 30 day campaign period you can help us raise awareness. Look out for #WhiteWalls and #SocialArtsMarket - share, retweet or post our stories and talk to your friends to spread the word.
Our Pillars
Social
By building relationships across businesses, charities, initiatives, art enthusiasts and artists we bring global art
to the local digital doorstep, we inspire cross-cultural exchange, deepen the cultural dialogue and ultimately
expand the exclusive arena of art creators, art lovers and art consumers.
The Social Arts Market provides the New Generation of collectors the opportunity to discover and invest in
talent they believe is up and coming and will appreciate in value. Active interest in a particular artwork or artist
will drive perceived worth and purchase price
column2: the Social Arts Market contributor, art creator or art consumer,

column1: can ride the trend and reap the rewards.

column4: >""<i>Working with the Social Arts Market gives the people we work with a unique opportunity to exhibit their work to a wider,

column1: more global audience and create awareness."" - Violeta Contreras Bravo, Artist and Art Studio Coordinator for a Dorset
based charity
Arts
We believe in inclusivity and diversity of art and artists. Jump in and add to our expanding pool of contributors.
Build relationships with fellow art enthusiasts, connect charities, initiatives and projects with businesses and
take part in a global movement that deepens cultural dialogue and broadens the exchange between art
creators, art lovers and art consumers.
By engaging everyone and not just a slice of the elite, the spotlight is refocused by a wider, more culturally
diverse community, bringing lesser-known artists into the limelight. Trends are actively shaped and driven by
the continued interaction and engagement of the contributors.
Market
Project Art is an eco-system that helps art creators, art lovers and art consumers to connect and follow their
passions.
The artwork’s value is determined in real time through the on-going activities, interactions and purchases - The
perpetual movement of engagement creates trends, which reflect truly democratic market dynamics,
continuously evolving and fluctuating.
We are partnering with charities who are working with artists from different backgrounds, so not only can you

buy artwork that you like but you can also make a difference.

","The crowd-curated Social Arts Market for artists and enthusiasts - revolutionising the art market.

We believe there is a better and simpler way to exhibit and collect art. We are creating a global community of artists and art enthusiasts who will discover, exhibit, curate, buy and connect through our online platform:
Project Art.
To build this community and create a level playing field for artists and those interested in art, we need you help. Pledge now and help us revolutionise the arts market.
The problem
As art enthusiasts we found that it is more difficult to start buying and collecting art than it needs to be. At the
same time a wealth of talented artists find it hard to break into a market that is heavily pre-curated and
exclusive.
To challenge the traditional model of the art market we created Project Art, providing artists and art enthusiasts
worldwide with a crowd-curated platform. By engaging everyone, we shape community-driven trends and
increase the range and variety of artworks available.”

column7:
>Short Summary

Hey everyone! I am Tawny Fritzinger and I am a freelance illustrator excited to attend the best workshop available in my industry. I have heard from dozens of artists and illustrators that attending Illustration Master Class (IMC) is a life-changing even and I feel I am ready to make that turn in my own life that will lead to a self-sustaining career as a Fantasy (and eventually, Sci-Fi) Illustrator! IMC provides the opportunity to work under several industry leaders such as Rebecca Guay, Greg Manchess, James Gurney, and Iain McCaig...among many others. It is a chance to sharpen my skills and learn what steps I need to take to take my art to the highest level!

column1:
Registration for IMC opens in October and fills up FAST! To ensure my spot in next year's class, I decided to start this campaign as early as possible. 

What I Need &

• My goal of $2500 will cover tuition, boarding, and meals for the duration of the class.
  • All money donated will go toward those costs, and any money raised beyond that goal will go toward travel expenses such as airfare!
  • If this goal is not met, I will reserve the money raised until I can fund the remainder of the tuition! You can rest assured that this money WILL go toward my attendance at Illustration Master Class! (If the goal is not met and you decide you would like a refund, please don't hesitate to contact me!)
<div>

$1 - Every dollar counts and every dollar is appreciated! A contribution of $1 will grant you my everlasting gratitude and the knowledge that you helped me in my journey to be the best illustrator I could possibly be. Thank you!
$10 - The title of ""Cool Contributor"" and one signed miniprint, randomly selected. Thank you!
$20 - The title of ""Supporter"" and two signed miniprints, your choice. Thank you!
$25 NEW PERK AS OF 10-18-2014!! With a contribution of $25 starting right meow, you get one (random) ORIGINAL #inktober sketch that I've created in the month of October! (while they last!)
$50 - The title of ""Super Spender"". One signed medium sized print of your choice, and a full set of FOUR signed miniprints! Thank you!

$100 - The title of ""Patron Apprentice"". A quick hand-drawn sketch, and full set of FOUR signed miniprints -OR- One signed large print of your choice and full set of FOUR signed miniprints! Thank you!!
$250 - What!? The title of ""Patron of the Arts"". One signed large sized print of your choice, a detailed hand-drawn sketch, and full set of FOUR signed miniprints! You're awesome!

$500 - Excellent!! The title of ""Patron Extraordinaire"". Full set of FOUR signed large sized prints, a detailed hand-drawn sketch, and a personal shout out thanks on Facebook/Twitter/Blog! -OR- a personalized art lesson (3hrs on Skype/Google Hangouts), and a personal shout out thanks on Facebook/Twitter/Blog!! Debts of gratitude!

$1000 - I can't believe it!! The title of ""Extreme Patron Superhero"". A personal digital commission, full set of three signed large sized prints, a personal hardcover sketchbook filled with studies and sketches, and a personal shout out thanks on Facebook/Twitter/Blog!!! -OR- A full mentorship based on everything I learn at Illustration Master Class (to be fulfilled after I attend of course!), full set of FOUR signed large sized prints, and a personal shout out thanks on Facebook/Twitter/Blog! You are my hero forever and always.
PRINTS:
Sacrifice
<div>
Elf Archer
And the much sought after, Saudade!
Newest addition: Into Knight!

Other Ways You Can Help!

Share this campaign on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, Email, etc! Encourage your friends to share the campaign! 
Feedback is always appreciated!

WE ALL
KNOW THAT BIG IS NOT ALWAYS CLEVER...
WE KNOW THAT IN
SMALL QUIET CORNERS ARE OFTEN THE MOST UNEXPECTED FINDS.
BA(Hons) Fine
Art for Design, Batley School of Art, Kirklees College.
We are ‘soon
to be graduates’ of BA(Hons) Fine Art for Design, a small degree programme with
a big heart and enormous ambition. We have been encouraged to think broadly, take
unconventional approaches, arrive at unexpected solutions and truly find our
own individual creative voices. . . and now we need to take ourselves and our
work to London.
Yes, we are
small but our aspiration is mighty.
As a small
course from a small northern town . . . well 8 miles from Leeds, 7 miles from
Huddersfield, 36 miles from Manchester, 163 miles from London, up a bit and
just to the right and inevitably 24 hours from Tulsa. . . we are taking our degree show to ‘that London’ – (Free
Range 2015).
This wonderful and we believe
wholly necessary, opportunity provides us with the perfect platform to showcase
our diverse artistic practice.
To be seen in the art capital of
the world and to engage with creative industry professionals, as well as networking
with our peers from other institutions is where we need and want to be.
Our exhibition entitled 'Closer' (closer
to professional life, closer to London, closer to achieving our aspirations)
spans a range of visual outcomes including printmaking, illustration, sculpture,
textiles, garments and photography.
Our work is
born out of integrity, a heartfelt desire to be the very best we can and the determination
to succeed.
BA(Hons) Fine
Art for Design have exhibited at Free Range for over 12 successive years and the
feedback from industry professionals, creative’s and the public has been
overwhelming.
To date, we
have been baking, borrowing, making, pleading to fundraise and we have nearly
everything we need
column2: this is the last little squeeze to raise funds for our

column1: venue costs.
We are a
hair’s breadth away and with your help we will be able to bang our gong and
raise a round of applause – we did it (but ONLY with YOUR help).
Your
contribution would help us achieve our goals and we couldn’t be more indebted
and grateful for that.<span>  We thank you from
the bottom of our hearts.

column1: We will arrange 36 cubes in 2.6 meter intervals arranged on a 30 meter diameter circle. The cubes will be illuminated in various bright lights, according to the light sequences generated by our computer, creating a movement and time sense of feeling.

We wanted to use an industrial product, that would be cut off from the environmental context of the desert, and would be made of material that interacts with light. This is how we got to the 1000 L liquid cubes.
The cubes are arranged in a circle, each one shifted 40 degrees from the other, the minimal shift needed to create the appearance of smooth motion as the light travels through.
<div>

In each cube, installed a RGB LED light fixture, controlled by a computer. Each light fixture is installed to the bottom of the cube perpendicularly, lighting the head of the cube, in each position. From each cube, the light is spread in different angles, emphasizing the virtual movement of the cube.

We’ve done the first test of it – It’s F*$@ing crazy and awesome:
What do we need?
That form of energy that is referred to when trying to transact goods – money :)

The total cost of all the electronics, material, instruments and the transportation of all of it on 2 full semi-trailer trucks, into the desert and back, is $14,000 .We raised already 5,000 $USD before this campaign.
We need 9,000 more.
<div>

As part of the community of Burningman, we thank you for your support. And if you are short with cash in the point this finds you, we completely understand – please donate by sharing and tagging on FB, forwarding in emails or just giving us a good ‘god speed’ blessing :)

<div>

We are – Meir, Lior and Golan from the Jungle Vibez  camp at Midburn 2015. Just regular Joes with regular jobs with a regular default life with a regular dog (Meir has a cat) wanting to manifest a regular concept – Time. We’ve been to Burning Man and it’s our second Midburn. We strongly and undoubtedly believe that creating exhibits of beauty or thought (or both) is not only our desire, as it’s everyone’s gift and purpose to each other in Burning Man events (and in default world in general).

Why are we doing this? 

We are a group of burners from the Middle East, who want to take the regional burn to the next level, and with this installation participate in the communal effort of creating the Burningman experience.

ing awesom

    • ","Dear Burners, help us bring the Life Cycle art installation to Midburn 2015

column1: Short Summary
Life Cyrcle is a 30 meter wide light art installation @ Midburn 2015  which deals with the motion of time, through static elements and light.
Midburn is the Middle East Regional Burningman event.
The philosophy

The Life Cycle will deal with the cyclicality and circularity of life. The installation will graphically demonstrate the movement of time with repetitive static elements spread on the playa. And will give you the sensation that everything is cyclic and all current states are temporarily.

The main Ingredient in our installation is light. Light is always all around us, like the clock's hands circling the watch. Projecting light through the static elements we are awaking them and make them dynamic. What that will create is the sense of motion and cyclicality.

The installation could be experienced from various points of view. You can be a bystander outside of the circle, with a partial point of view. Or stand in the center of the circle, where the viewer can follow the motion of the installation with his body and sight. Having a continuous and 360 degree point of view would give the sensation of the circular cyclicality and would make the viewer feel as one with the installation.
How are we going to do it

We will arrange 36 cubes in 2.6 meter intervals arranged on a 30 meter diameter circle. The cubes will be illuminated in various bright lights, according to the light sequences generated by our computer, creating a movement and time sense of feeling.

We wanted to use an industrial product, that would be cut off from the environmental context of the desert, and would be made of material that interacts with light. This is how we got to the 1000 L liquid cubes.
The cubes are arranged in a circle, each one shifted 40 degrees from the other, the minimal shift needed to create the appearance of smooth motion as the light travels through.

In each cube, installed a RGB LED light fixture, controlled by a computer. Each light fixture is installed to the bottom of the cube perpendicularly, lighting the head of the cube, in each position. From each cube, the light is spread in different angles, emphasizing the virtual movement of the cube.
Our installation requirements:
2  semi trailer trucks  for transportation
36  Plastic Cubes 1m X 1m X 1.2m
36 RGB Led light fixtures 150W each (total of 5400 Watts!!!!)
120 meters of tunel diging
120 meters DMX comunication cables
120 meters electricity cables
1 main light computer
140 meter of iron construction profiles.
144 iron pegs.
9 crew members
We’ve done the first test of it – It’s F*$@ing crazy and awesome:
What do we need from you !?
What do we need?
That form of energy that is referred to when trying to transact goods – money :)
not so much, but still...

The total cost of all the electronics, material, instruments and the transportation of all of it on 2 full semi-trailer trucks, into the desert and back, is $14,000 .We raised already 5,000 $USD before this campaign.
We need 9,000 more.
Other ways you can help

As part of the community of Burningman, we thank you for your support. And if you are short with cash in the point this finds you, we completely understand – please donate by sharing and tagging on FB, forwarding in emails or just giving us a good ‘god speed’ blessing :)
Come help with the construction and preparations!
Come help with the installation in the desert before the event!
Our Awesome Perks
Our pedants are in the making:
Who are we ?
let’s be polite and introduce ourselves:

We are – Meir, Lior and Golan from the Jungle Vibez  camp at Midburn 2015. Just regular Joes with regular jobs with a regular default life with a regular dog (Meir has a cat) wanting to manifest a regular concept – Time. We’ve been to Burning Man and it’s our second Midburn. We strongly and undoubtedly believe that creating exhibits of beauty or thought (or both) is not only our desire, as it’s everyone’s gift and purpose to each other in Burning Man events (and in default world in general).

Why are we doing this? We are a group of burners from the Middle East, who want to take the regional burn to the next level, and with this installation participate in the communal effort of creating the Burningman experience.Whats in it for you?  You execute 1 of the burning man principles – Communal effortHelp some regular Joes fulfill their dreamEnhance the Midburn event and experience – it's gonna look f*$&ing awesomMeir promised his Mom she gonna be proud of him – don’t make Meir disappoint       mama",16.0,2,"1 Campaign
|","Tel-Aviv, Israel",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/life-cycle-burningman-middle-east-midburn2015/pica

Rebuild the Mirage
The Mirage is a Mutant Vehicle (Art Car) that was built for Burning Man 2012 by myself (Wisey) and a small team of volunteers.
I am an engineer and an artist and I have built art cars for Burning Man each year for the last 5 years. Lots of people have had lots of fun on these vehicles.

The car is made to be almost invisible from the outside as its surface is constructed from 2-way surveilance mirror. As a result the desert is reflected off the bottom and the sky is reflected off the top and the car becomes like a mirage.
From the inside the playa is fully visible through the 2 way mirror. Those inside can see out but those outside cannot see in.
The inside of the Mirage is covered in memory foam and white fur to make it soft and cuddly wherever you decide to lean.
The top deck of the Mirage features a comfortable lounge area as well as a bar and a DJ booth.
<div>
What We Need

Unfortunately, there was a storm in Reno in December 2012 that was more powerful than any other in the last 20 years. 120mph winds ripped all of the mirrors from the frame of the Mirage and smashed them all over the floor. The car was luckily parked above the level of the flooding and was safe from water damage. All the LED parcans and other lighting for the vehicle however were stored in the barn and did not fare quite as well.

We now need to purchase a whole new set of mirrors to rebuild the mirage as well as new lights to illuminate it at night time on the dark playa. The mirrors were unfortunately, the most expensive part of the build.
<div>
The Impact
Your contribution will make sure that the Mirage makes it to Burning Man 2013 for a whole new group of burners to experience the joys of riding an art car.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute financially to the project, please share this campaign with others who can.
If you will be in Reno in the week before Burning Man 2013, we need extra hands to help us fit the new mirrors and lights and pick up all the pieces of smashed mirror that are left after the storm.

Overview

This collection of hand-drawn portraits represents Badass Women whose actions have advanced equality in the world we know. Remind yourself every month that the world is full of inspirational Badass Women. Pre-order yours here to guarantee your copy. Stay Badass.

What is it?

It's a calendar! And when 2020 is over, it's 12 Badass art prints!

Each month features a hand-drawn portrait of a Badass Woman and important dates to remember.

Including such badasses as:

Irene Morgan
Reshma Saujani
Simone Biles
Emma Tenayuca
Bernadette Devlin

AND MORE

Important dates include things like:

January 22: Roe v. Wade decided in 1973
March 15: RBG's B-day
September 20: Billie Jean King won the Battle of the Sexes on this day in 1973

+US Holidays, except Columbus Day because F that guy (marked as Indigenous People's Day)
 

How much is it?

Each calendar is priced at $20, with discounts for bulk orders
(2 for $36, 5 for $80, 10 for $125, 20 for $200)

**If you would like an amount not listed as a perk, please contact me and we can make it work! thebadasswomen@gmail.com **

OR if you intend to pick up locally in Philadelphia, Bethlehem, or New Orleans, click BACK IT and enter the appropriate amount (without shipping).  Please contact me if you have any questions! thebadasswomen@gmail.com

Pre-ordering during this campaign includes FREE shipping for individual calendars and significantly discounted shipping for bulk orders!

 

Why a Badass Women Calendar?

I was blown away with the support that the past 3 Badass Women Calendars received, and I'm so excited that y'all want more!

Since the first Badass Women Calendar I made (right after the 2016 election) I've seen so many other awesome artists creating portraits of incredible women to celebrate their achievements.

In this edition of the Badass Women Calendar, I hope to especially lift up some people who you haven't heard of, and the group of 12 each year is increasingly international. It's also always very important to me to feature mostly women of color, since women of color in particular have traditionally been written out of history.

I'm excited to announce that this year I will be donating a percentage of the profits from the project to Women With A Vision, Inc.
 

Getting Going

I am thrilled to be working with Fireball Printing again to produce the calendar-- a local Philadelphia company I truly admire for its transparency, environmental options, high quality products, and customer service, and they employ a bunch of women to boot.

I have already sent the calendar to print (!) and this pre-order campaign will help me recoup some of the printing cost before sales really pick up closer to the holidays.
 

Is it rad?

Yes it is rad. I was pretty sure it was rad when I first started this project, but I have been really touched at how much support its gotten, and I'm so jazzed that so many people are hyped about celebrating badass women.

It has been awesome not only to support myself as an artist and activist with this project, but because I'm able to sell the calendar in local shops across the country, I'm supporting many women-owned businesses as well. PLUS it feels really good to donate a portion of the proceeds to different women's non-profit each year.

 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

If you pre-order a calendar, you will definitely receive one (unless some unforeseen circumstances prohibit the whole project from finishing, in which case, you'll receive a refund).

There is a small general risk your delivery could be delayed by USPS. (If you do not receive your calendar by Nov. 15, please contact me)

column1:
Other Ways to be Involved

Even if you can't pre-order a calendar right now, you can totally share this with your mom and hint that it would make a GREAT gift, or tip off your local badass boutique to order some wholesale.

Please share this with someone who you think would love this project! <
column2:
3

Finally, head over to @thebadasswomen on Instagram and give me a follow if you can!
Find out more at www.thebadasswomen.com

""Do you carry Vegan Leather?"" LOL!!

Someone asked me this at one of our accessory shows...how to answer?  Pleather? Faux leather?

We do not offer ""vegan"" leather but we do re-purpose all the leather in our designs by up-cycling leather scraps and vintage belts!
• This campaign is to help owner and artist Rachel Bierma support the green trend of repurposed materials in the fashion industry
• This will be realized through an educational photo shoot and creation of a look book to help communicate the style and Eco-friendly designs we have to offer
What We Need &

• To complete our goals we need $3000 to cover everything including photographer, models, wardrobe, stylist, hair/makeup, site fees, creation of look book, and other associated expenses for the one full day shoot.  These pictures will be of my most exciting and core designs so that the content will be relevant for a long time.
• Donation suggestions:
• $0-20 great big thank you and first look at the photos before the world learns more about green leather products!
• $25 receives perk of handmade leather cuff or simple leather earrings.
• $50 receives perk of handmade custom tie or belt necklace.  I will work with your color requests and basic style to design a one of a kind piece!
• $100 receives up to $125 of product of choice off the website or 2 custom design pieces as described above.
• Color choice of brown or black unless custom piece.  Cuff will be ~7 inches closed unless you request a certain size.  Please submit the type of perk with donation.
• If for some reason we don't reach our goal in the 60 days, all of the funds will go towards the event still but adjustments will be made to level of services provided to reduce costs.

The Impact

B. Rustik wants to help the fashion world and the everyday person know that you can use re-purposed materials to create unique cutting edge designs.  As many know in today's online market, great photos and word of mouth are our best tools.  Let's get the word out and encourage local handmade artists!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help!

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about B.Rustik's new designs by forwarding this campaign or by sharing this with Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram friends!

In 1956, almost a year after Disneyland opened, Storybook Land began taking visitors through its gateway to enchantment and past miniature scenes from many classic Disney films.  After years of being exposed the elements, many of the original buildings were replaced with exact duplicates, but constructed with more modern and durable materials.  One particular set of buildings, the ""French Village"" that sat just below Cinderella's pink and gold castle, was saved and eventually donated to the Carolwood Foundation.  At 57 years old, the village today is nearly unsalvageable, but it still retains so much amazing detail that it begs to be restored as a piece of Walt Disney's history and a tribute to his love of miniatures.

The Carolwood Foundation is now embarking on this careful restoration, preserving as much of the wood structure as possible and rebuilding new sections that have been destroyed or have gone missing altogether.  Once completed, the village will become an entirely new exhibit at Walt's Barn in Griffith Park, entitled ""The Small Worlds of Walt.""  The exhibit will educate visitors about scale models and explore the different miniatures, large and small, that Walt wanted to put into his park.  Whether its Main Street, Sleeping Beauty Castle, The Disneyland Railroad, Storybook Land or the Carolwood Barn, they are all The Small Worlds of Walt.

The Carolwood Foundation needs your help to bring these beloved miniatures back to life.  Our hope is that the Disney fan community can come together to fund the restoration and the construction of the exhibit so that these priceless pieces of history can be enjoyed up close for generations to come.
Please visit www.smallworldsofwalt.com to see the progress of the restoration and find out how you can help become a part of this important endeavor.
<h3>What We Need &amp

The funds raised will be going first to purchase supplies needed to preserve and restore the village, then towards building the ""Small Worlds of Walt"" exhibit wagon so that the Storybook Land village can be put on display for visitors to Walt's Barn to enjoy for years.  Any extra funds raised will go towards a new on-site storage building for the exhibit wagon as well and towards bringing the exhibit on the road to future fan conventions and expos.
Our fundraising milestones are broken down like this:
$4000 completes the restoration
$6000 completes the mobile display for expos and conventions
$9000 completes the ""Small Worlds of Walt"" exhibit wagon for outdoor protection.
$9000+ contributes to the building of an on-site storage building at Walt's Barn
The Impact

If you feel just as strongly about preserving the history of Walt Disney, the history of Disneyland and the history of imagineering then we would greatly appreciate your help.  The Carolwood Foundation is in no way associated with the Walt Disney Company and we operate completely through the dedication and hard work of volunteers.  Preservation and educating the puplic about Walt's personal passions of railroading and miniatures give people a new perspective on the theme parks that people know and love.  We take up this responsiblity with great pleasure knowing that these historic pieces will continue to delight, educate and enchant generations to come.
Perks
Exclusive Richard Terpstra designed t-shirt
Prototype Pin design*
Monstro Reward Level - A piece of the original Storybook Land village.**
*Design/Final appearance subject to change.
**Design/Final appearance subject to change.  Size and shape of each piece will vary slightly.

willyCat.org ... the original willyCat
Hello everyone ... my name is Todd, and I am a creative guy born in Toronto Canada. My design website is called WillyZ.com ... you can always reach me via email Todd@willyCat.org
I am not here to talk about WillyZ ... I am here, looking for a few favours from you nice folks in regards to a project I have been developing called willyCat.
However, before you read any furher ... please, first read my Indiegogo Update post on willyCat.org ... it is only fair for the people who have stumbled onto this page.
I am requesting folks, kindly help me reach three goals for willyCat.
<ol>
• Please pledge and help spread the word ... with that done, I will reach the first goal of $13,888 and sign the purchase order ... which is all ready for willyCat's production.
• Please help me go beyond that goal and help me find loving homes for every willyCat.
• Help me reunite the original willyCat with his long lost Ellen.
I have always wanted to be an entrepreneur ... that is, other than a starving artist ... I also have a strong passion for comedy ... and really enjoy making people laugh and smile.
You may ask yourself ... what has willyCat done for me lately?

Well ... basically up until now ... nothing ... but seriously ... Cats really don't do much of anything ... other than just eat and sleep ... I can't believe we haven't figured out how to make Cats do something useful with that can opener sound ... they all seem to jump when they hear it.
<div>

Not only has willyCat done absolutely nothing for you ... willyCat is asking you to check out his website and get to know him a little bit ... if you are still reading this ... I am already grateful ... you are almost half way through this ordeal.
I am going to make up for the lack of effort from the unbelievably lazy willyCat ... I am offering a few token perks for those willing to help willyCat out ... and yes, all perks include delivery.
I am quite confident ... those who receive the willyCat perks ... will not be disappointed.
<div>
How awesome is willyCat?
willyCat is made from 100% recycled plastic bottles … the idea is to create, not just an amazing stuffed Cat … but one who does his part in helping with the environment.
There will be a limited production run of 3,000 willyCats and every willyCat will include a numbered and signed Certificate of Authenticity.
Of those 3,000 ... 888 willyCats will have numbered tags and collars.

I did extensive research on some of the best teddy bear companies in the world … I catalogued what made their products so superior … and then I put a little bit of everything I found into creating willyCat.

Things such as the extra liner and structure strings that are built inside willyCat … plus every part of willyCat is third party laboratory tested to assure that willyCat is a safe choice for children.
My thinking is ... quality is paramount ... willyCat needs to be totally comfortable spending time in the washing machine ... and come GameTime ... he needs to be OK being the football if need be.

Through my long hours of research … I discovered there were dozens of places and several levels of quality I could produce willyCat at, however, one very important factor, other than his environmental footprint … I want willyCat to outlive everyone who owns him.

You may be thinking about the plastic bottles, and wonder ... is willyCat safe and soft enough for infants? ... you bet he is ... even the pictures do not show how amazing willyCat actually is ... the vision for willyCat, is for him to be every child's absolute favourite ... willyCat was created to be very loveable ... his cuteness ... that just happened.
The colour of willyCat is brownish with beige paws ... I designed him with these colours for a reason ... when willyCat is in his senior years ... he will, pretty much look the same colour.
<div>
Wow ... I can't believe you are still reading this!
Seriously now ... somebody must be wondering ... who is Ellen?

Let me cut to the chase here ... willyCat is on Facebook ... he is also on Pinterest ... and he is following people on his Twitter page ... he is following people, he says he knows (but honestly ... I think he's making that part up).
These people he follows on Twitter give a clue as to who will be mentioned next on his website ... such as ... he was following Tom before the question arose ... who is Tom?
willyCat only follows certain people ... a few people coming up are Ron, Henry and Jerry ... no offence meant, but willyCat will not be following any of the Kardashians.
This campaign comes to an end when all the willyCats are living in homes with loving families ... and ... not forgotten, the original willyCat is finally reunited with Ellen.
That may bring the end to this campaign ... however, it will be just the beginning for willyCat.

I am creating willyCat as a brand ... if I am able reach the second goal and find homes for the first litter of willyCats ... the totally redesigned Limited Edition 2014 willyCats will be created next summer and also be available in time for the holidays.
The pricing for the 2014 Limited Edition willyCats are projected to be $28.88 for the 888 tagged willyCats and $19.88 for one with only a Authenticity Certificate.

The website is planned to continue on with the willyCat brand ... even after the original willyCat is reunited with Ellen ... I will encourage, and offer perks for people to submit pictures and stories about their willyCats.

A bit more about me ... I have worked in the Graphic Arts and Printing Industry for 30 years and even though I am able to create websites ... I honestly have never spent more than 5 minutes on YouTube and have never made a video before ... again, sorry about the vid ... it was my first try.

I was going to put willyCat up here for 30 days ... however I am going to throw him to the masses now and see if things progress ... I have put some serious research and work into this project ... and what you will see in the next two weeks? ... something else I am working on ... cartoon willyCat.

You may think this idea is completely bonkers ... and that's OK ... it is ... I heard someone once say ... half the content online was about Cats ... so I thought ... why not see if there is room for one more original willyCat.

The crazy bottom line is ... who puts in this amount of work? ... I don't even own a Cat ...however, with the massive research ... the original willyCat website ... several domain names to protect the willyCat brand, such as willyCats.com ... the actual willyCat prototype built from the plastic bottles ... the list of what has been put into this project is very long.

I am thinking maybe ... one day, I am not sure when, but maybe one day ... I will receive an email from willyCat's long lost Ellen ... even if, all the email says, is ... OK, put willyCat in a FedEx box and send him to me.
Now that you have read down to this point ... I truly must thank you ... the last request I have is ... please read about, what I mean by mentioning the FedEx box under the Who is Tom story.
Cheers Todd
... please help spread the word of willyCat
11 hours to go ... they hid this campaign the whole time ... not even in the final countdown did it appear.
","willyCat.org ... the original willyCat
Hello everyone ... my name is Todd, and I am a creative guy born in Toronto Canada. My design website is called WillyZ.com ... you can always reach me via email Todd@willyCat.org
I am not here to talk about WillyZ ... I am here, looking for a few favours from you nice folks in regards to a project I have been developing called willyCat.
However, before you read any furher ... please, first read my Indiegogo Update post on willyCat.org ... it is only fair for the people who have stumbled onto this page.
I am requesting folks, kindly help me reach three goals for willyCat.
Please pledge and help spread the word ... with that done, I will reach the first goal of $13,888 and sign the purchase order ... which is all ready for willyCat's production.
Please help me go beyond that goal and help me find loving homes for every willyCat.
Help me reunite the original willyCat with his long lost Ellen.
I have always wanted to be an entrepreneur ... that is, other than a starving artist ... I also have a strong passion for comedy ... and really enjoy making people laugh and smile.
You may ask yourself ... what has willyCat done for me lately?

Well ... basically up until now ... nothing ... but seriously ... Cats really don't do much of anything ... other than just eat and sleep ... I can't believe we haven't figured out how to make Cats do something useful with that can opener sound ... they all seem to jump when they hear it.

Not only has willyCat done absolutely nothing for you ... willyCat is asking you to check out his website and get to know him a little bit ... if you are still reading this ... I am already grateful ... you are almost half way through this ordeal.
I am going to make up for the lack of effort from the unbelievably lazy willyCat ... I am offering a few token perks for those willing to help willyCat out ... and yes, all perks include delivery.
I am quite confident ... those who receive the willyCat perks ... will not be disappointed.
How awesome is willyCat?
willyCat is made from 100% recycled plastic bottles … the idea is to create, not just an amazing stuffed Cat … but one who does his part in helping with the environment.
There will be a limited production run of 3,000 willyCats and every willyCat will include a numbered and signed Certificate of Authenticity.
Of those 3,000 ... 888 willyCats will have numbered tags and collars.

I did extensive research on some of the best teddy bear companies in the world … I catalogued what made their products so superior … and then I put a little bit of everything I found into creating willyCat.

Things such as the extra liner and structure strings that are built inside willyCat … plus every part of willyCat is third party laboratory tested to assure that willyCat is a safe choice for children.
My thinking is ... quality is paramount ... willyCat needs to be totally comfortable spending time in the washing machine ... and come GameTime ... he needs to be OK being the football if need be.

Through my long hours of research … I discovered there were dozens of places and several levels of quality I could produce willyCat at, however, one very important factor, other than his environmental footprint … I want willyCat to outlive everyone who owns him.

You may be thinking about the plastic bottles, and wonder ... is willyCat safe and soft enough for infants? ... you bet he is ... even the pictures do not show how amazing willyCat actually is ... the vision for willyCat, is for him to be every child's absolute favourite ... willyCat was created to be very loveable ... his cuteness ... that just happened.
The colour of willyCat is brownish with beige paws ... I designed him with these colours for a reason ... when willyCat is in his senior years ... he will, pretty much look the same colour.
Wow ... I can't believe you are still reading this!
Seriously now ... somebody must be wondering ... who is Ellen?

Let me cut to the chase here ... willyCat is on Facebook ... he is also on Pinterest ... and he is following people on his Twitter page ... he is following people, he says he knows (but honestly ... I think he's making that part up).
These people he follows on Twitter give a clue as to who will be mentioned next on his website ... such as ... he was following Tom before the question arose ... who is Tom?
willyCat only follows certain people ... a few people coming up are Ron, Henry and Jerry ... no offence meant, but willyCat will not be following any of the Kardashians.
This campaign comes to an end when all the willyCats are living in homes with loving families ... and ... not forgotten, the original willyCat is finally reunited with Ellen.
That may bring the end to this campaign ... however, it will be just the beginning for willyCat.

I am creating willyCat as a brand ... if I am able reach the second goal and find homes for the first litter of willyCats ... the totally redesigned Limited Edition 2014 willyCats will be created next summer and also be available in time for the holidays.
The pricing for the 2014 Limited Edition willyCats are projected to be $28.88 for the 888 tagged willyCats and $19.88 for one with only a Authenticity Certificate.

The website is planned to continue on with the willyCat brand ... even after the original willyCat is reunited with Ellen ... I will encourage, and offer perks for people to submit pictures and stories about their willyCats.

A bit more about me ... I have worked in the Graphic Arts and Printing Industry for 30 years and even though I am able to create websites ... I honestly have never spent more than 5 minutes on YouTube and have never made a video before ... again, sorry about the vid ... it was my first try.

I was going to put willyCat up here for 30 days ... however I am going to throw him to the masses now and see if things progress ... I have put some serious research and work into this project ... and what you will see in the next two weeks? ... something else I am working on ... cartoon willyCat.

You may think this idea is completely bonkers ... and that's OK ... it is ... I heard someone once say ... half the content online was about Cats ... so I thought ... why not see if there is room for one more original willyCat.

The crazy bottom line is ... who puts in this amount of work? ... I don't even own a Cat ...however, with the massive research ... the original willyCat website ... several domain names to protect the willyCat brand, such as willyCats.com ... the actual willyCat prototype built from the plastic bottles ... the list of what has been put into this project is very long.

I am thinking maybe ... one day, I am not sure when, but maybe one day ... I will receive an email from willyCat's long lost Ellen ... even if, all the email says, is ... OK, put willyCat in a FedEx box and send him to me.
Now that you have read down to this point ... I truly must thank you ... the last request I have is ... please read about, what I mean by mentioning the FedEx box under the Who is Tom story.
Cheers Todd
... please help spread the word of willyCat
11 hours to go ... they hid this campaign the whole time ... not even in the final countdown did it appear.",9.0,0,"1 Campaign

SEND ME TO VIENNA
Hi Everybodee,

My name is Mica Sigourney/VivvyAnne ForeverMORE! For those of you that don't know me I am a performer, Drag Queen and choreographer living in San Francisco California. I've been making performance in the Bay Area for 5 years, and been getting up on stage for 28 years (since I was five). To get more familiar you can read what the Bay Guardian recently wrote about me when I won a Local Discovery Award for Performance here: http://www.sfbg.com/2012/11/13/goldies-2012-mica-sigourney

I have the honor of being accepted to DanceWeb, the scholarship program at ImPulsTanz. Over 1,000 performers and dancers from around the world apply to DanceWeb every year, this year they accepted 66 folks and I'm one of them. I'll be participating in an international contemporary performance festival in July and August of 2013 in Vieanna Austria. It's a game changer in my arts and performance making: I'll have 5 weeks of intensive study, exchange of ideas with global artists and leaders, and 1 on 1 one coaching with this years mentor.

This oppurtunity comes at a time when I am seeking to really formalize the experiences I've had over the past 5 years in San Francisco's nightlife and drag scenes.  I had considered grad school but don't want to upset my life and my commitment to making happenings and performances for my community here in San Francisco. DanceWeb is the perfect oppurtunity to enrich my understanding and experiences of international contemporary performance while connecting with other artists and making inroads to oppurtunities abroad for me and  for the folks I work with here in San Francisco.
<div>
WHAT I NEED TO GET THERE
To get to DanceWeb I must complete 1/3 cost of tuition, buy a plane ticket, and feed myself while I'm there, plus miscellaneous costs.
Unlike European participants who get government funding, participants from America generally have to secure private donations from family, friends, and amazing supporters like you.

My goal is to raise money through grant applications, my own hard work and the squirreling away of pennies and dollars, and finally reaching out to my friends, family and community (and beyond) through indie-agogo.
My goal is to raise $4,700 through indie-agogo. This will cover tuition and most of my travel.

What you will get from participating is not only the knowledge that you are enhancing my education and experience, which allows me to make deeper, more exciting, nuanced and BETTERER performances for you, my audiences and communities, but also some special perks.
Which you can check out on the sidebar
<div>
A LITTLE MORE ABOUT THE IMPACT

While I've touched on this briefly already I do believe sending me to DanceWeb will not just make me a happy art maker but will also enhance my community here in San Francisco. Those of you who know me know that I continually collaborate with those around me, my ongoing project Work MORE! annually pairs artists in new collaborations and comissions them to create new works (I've currently secured funds to make the next Work MORE! fully funded, and profitable for the artists). As a performer my work is very social, I rarely hole up in the studio alone, instead favoring large group rehearsals, orchestrating informal creative gatherings, and getting my stuff on stage in front of folks, sharing what i've made.

This is an awesome oppurtunity for me to take in a lot of information from a lot of sources I'd otherwise not have access to. I'm excited not just to go to Vienna but to come back and share what I've learned and gained with those around me. I'm not gonna sit here and pretend it's 100% altruistic, I think it's gonna be super fun and really eye opening. But my track record has proven that I'm pretty social and really want to share with my community.
Please share this with anyone you think might want to contribute.
(campaign video edited by: Hokulani Beale)

Help Kim Nicolini's Dead Rock Stars Come To Life

Kim Nicolini has been drawing with pens since she was a young girl. Her Dead Rock Star project is a culmination of 52 years of drawing, channeling emotion and spirit and the frailty of human nature and creating seismic maps on paper of the human psyche with all its complex longings, passions, terrors and vulnerabilities.

Kim has been offered a solo show of her Dead Rock Stars series at Beyond Baroque in Venice, CA, and she needs your help to make this show a reality.

Every dollar donated to this campaign will help Kim fund materials to make her lifetime dream come true. Working her way from the ground up, literally receiving a street education during her teen years, Kim is a self-taught artist who has poured her very soul and every inch of her life experiences and her intense compassion for others into her work. This show is her chance to share her work with the world. Please help her make it a success.


What Kim Needs and What You Will Get

Kim needs to raise $3,000 for expenses related to her solo show. These include the cost of matting and framing her art, book production, posters, postcards, promotional and advertisement materials, and travel so Kim can be in LA for the show.
Every single dollar raised will support this project, and everyone who contributes will receive unique Dead Rock Star memorabilia.

Impact

Your support will help make Kim's lifetime dream come true.
<ul>
• Beyond Baroque has committed the dates and the space for the show. All we need is the funding for materials to hang the show, make the books, and get Kim there. You can make that real.
• Open doors to new opportunities for Kim and her art, and let the world know about Pen Noise. Give people many faces which reflect their own humanity.
• Keep authenticity and sincerity in art alive!
• Help Kim produce a rare limited edition art book and art catalog with unique writing that will only be available in these books.
• Kim will be giving multiple readings at bookstores and appear on radio shows to help promote the show.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

There is nothing to lose with your contribution. Everyone comes out a winner. The show hangs. Kim's Pen Noise leaves its mark on the world. And everyone has a piece of humanity to hold onto.

  • Kim has fought tooth and nail throughout her life to make art, to develop her style, to put her life experiences and human empathy into art. This exhibit gives her a chance to solidify her hard work and the long road she has traveled in real terms.

column1: • Kim has always been a resourceful survivor. If she is unable to meet her goal, she will find new and creative ways to hang her work, but since this is a First In Her Life Opportunity, she wants the show to look great, be great, and exhibit her work in the way it deserves with white mats inside black frames en masse filling the gallery, and with finally crafted books which contain Kim's unique and impassioned writing to accompany the show.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share information on my campaign.
• Share my artist website: http://www.kimnicolini.com/
• Put potential contributors directly in touch with Kim at knicolini@gmail.com

And that's all there is to it.

Short Summary

Pre-Order 'Hardscapes: The Photography of Rachelle Mendez' by Laura Black and Dr. Joanna Roche, a 50+ page full color book to be published on the occasion of the exhibition of the same name at Gallery UV. Support for this project is provided by Universal Voice Inc.
<ul>
<li>
About Us -- Universal Voice is a non-profit 501(c)3 that was established to provide exhibition, publication, and professional development opportunities to female creatives.

• About the Artist -- Rachelle Mendez grew up in Northern California on acres of open land in a small rural community outside of Sacramento. After moving to Southern California to obtain a bachelor degree in Advertising/ Graphic Design she started exploring the idea of photographing the expansive rural landscape in a more graphic and concise way. This aesthetic led to her first on going photo series
column2: The Rural. Slowly evolving from the expansive landscapes to the highly congested landscapes of Los Angeles and Orange County’s suburbs, Rachelle created her most passionate and inclusive series
column3: Minimal and Contemporary Landscape photographs of California.

column7:

\\What is the North End Urban Arts Festival?//

The North End Urban Arts Festival is a call for creative uprising in one of Wichita’s most diverse, yet under celebrated neighborhoods. The Festival, the first of its kind in Kansas, is a free community even that is open to the public
column8: all are welcome to attend. It features local visual and performing artists, musicians and artisans. Last year, at the very first North End Urban Arts Festival, over 1000 attendees experienced 5 local musical acts, 60 artists and crafters, 5 local street food vendors, and beer garden. In addition, those who came experienced live street art displays, such as graffiti artists
column9:
along with interactive displays.


\\We have big dreams and a sincere vision//
column13: >This year’s Festival has the potential to attract thousands of people from inside and outside of Sedgwick County to the North End community, and we see this as an opportunity to promote the assets that make the North End District a unique experience. As such, all t
column17: >he funding collected through this campaign will be used exclusively to cover costs associated with the production of the festival. We want to present a high quality festival that attracts young audiences from across the city.

column1: We are committed to local artists, makers, and creators, to elevate their businesses and to contribute to the local economy. It is in that spirit that we seek to broaden the horizons of community expression, and setting the precedent a high quality festival and cultural interventions to come.
\\The Team//

<b>The North End Urban Arts Festival has a host of creative talent that helped make last year’s festival a resounding success. Veronica Miranda, artist facilitator, Festival founder and co-chair of the Festival
column2: Thomas Dalton, artist facilitator, co-chair and Festival concert organizer
column3: Armando Minjarez, founder and resident artist of The Seed House, cultural educator and community organizer
column4: and Hugo Zelada Romero, artist and founder of The Bomb Shelter art show.

column1: \\Other Ways You Can Help//
You want to help but can't do it financially?? We have opportunities for you! Visit our website www.NorthEndUrbanArtsFest.com for volunteer opportunities, to become a vendor, or display your art.
<ul>
• Tell your friends about the festival and how to get involved!
• Don't forget to click the ""SHARE"" button and spread the love!

The North End Urban Arts Festival is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The North End Urban Arts Festival must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

ABOUT FUZZY HEAD:

column5: >Following McColm's 2018 Slamdance Film Festival standout Bird Without Feathers, Fuzzy Head is Wendy's sophomore, breakout feature film, a
column17: >urrealistic, female-driven indie thriller. P
column21: >roduction is well underway and spearheaded by Wendy McColm, alongside executive producer,
column25: >Rhianon Jones, producers Courtney Paige, Santiago Cervintes and Trikon's head of production, Gia Rigoli. Also helping complete the film is co producer Cooper Oznowicz, executive producers Celina Biurrun and Rylan Oleksyn, line producer Nicholas Adam Clark and associate producer Steven Richmond. Production is well underway in Los Angeles, California with one week in Vancouver, BC, Canada and three days in Colorado. With your support, Wendy will be able to complete production on her second feature, with the tools she needs to achieve her artistic vision with commercial viability. Your assistance would allow us to move into post and have a magical cut to submit to festivals. So far, the cast includes Alicia Witt (88 Minutes), Rain Phoenix (Hitch), and Numa Perrier (Queen Sugar).

column1: The McColm-penned script is based on her original story and centers on Marla (portrayed by McColm) who must sift through childhood memories and trauma to unlock the truth about her mother’s death.
Wendy studied at Upright Citizen's Brigade and Meisner, acting in shows like Community, and How I Met Your Mother. She is considered one of the top emerging directors of 2020.
Share this campaign and spread the love. Every bit helps!
https://trikon.xyz/

https://www.wendyfilms.com/
http://globetrotterpictures.com/
","ABOUT FUZZY HEAD:

Following McColm's 2018 Slamdance Film Festival standout Bird Without Feathers, Fuzzy Head is Wendy's sophomore, breakout feature film, a surrealistic, female-driven indie thriller. Production is well underway and spearheaded by Wendy McColm, alongside executive producer, Rhianon Jones, producers Courtney Paige, Santiago Cervintes and Trikon's head of production, Gia Rigoli. Also helping complete the film is co producer Cooper Oznowicz, executive producers Celina Biurrun and Rylan Oleksyn, line producer Nicholas Adam Clark and associate producer Steven Richmond. Production is well underway in Los Angeles, California with one week in Vancouver, BC, Canada and three days in Colorado. With your support, Wendy will be able to complete production on her second feature, with the tools she needs to achieve her artistic vision with commercial viability. Your assistance would allow us to move into post and have a magical cut to submit to festivals. So far, the cast includes Alicia Witt (88 Minutes), Rain Phoenix (Hitch), and Numa Perrier (Queen Sugar).
The McColm-penned script is based on her original story and centers on Marla (portrayed by McColm) who must sift through childhood memories and trauma to unlock the truth about her mother’s death.
Wendy studied at Upright Citizen's Brigade and Meisner, acting in shows like Community, and How I Met Your Mother. She is considered one of the top emerging directors of 2020.
Share this campaign and spread the love. Every bit helps!
https://trikon.xyz/
https://www.wendyfilms.com/

Summary of this campaign
I began covering the conflict in Ukraine's east after my longterm job/role was made redundant in 2015.

Since then I have made regular trips to Ukraine, kept in contact with friends, developed relationships with new sources, continued to share information, and met more people affected or touched by the war, both in Ukraine and Australia. I have made no profit from my work, and continue to do it because I feel it is important, and socially/historically valuable.

This IndieGogo campaign will help me raise funds to develop and realise an exhibition of photography and video captured in Ukraine. I unsuccessfully applied to exhibit at this gallery in 2016. A follow-up application was approved in 2017, and I now have the chance to present my work to people in Melbourne, Australia, and share the stories I've been trusted to tell. This is my first exhibition in a gallery environment.
'Moreland City Council - Донбасс (Donbas): Photography from Ukraine’s war-torn east'
The exhibition will hold an opening night on Friday 26th April, 2018, and run for one month, closing on the 27th of May, 2018. The work will appear as part of the 2018 Human Rights Arts &
column2: Film Festival. The Ukrainian Ambassador to Australia will be attending, and making an opening speech/remarks.

column1: I will invite Ukrainian diaspora communities, and openly request anyone interested attend on the evening. I believe this exhibition, and my work, is a genuine opportunity to share an underreported global issue with the people of Melbourne, and Australia.
Where will raised funds be used?

I hope to raise $1,000 AUD (maximum) to develop this exhibition. These funds will be used for printing and framing of photographs, and any other exhibition-related costs. I personally will pay the same amount as a fee for using the gallery space.
I have created this crowdfunding campaign to assist me in creating this exhibition, however I recognise it is my responsibility alone if it is not successful.
Any unused funds will be donated to an appropriate NGO assisting people in Ukraine's east.
Outline the impact
I believe my project is valuable, as the conflict in Ukraine is underreported around the world, especially in Australia.

27 Australian citizens were killed when MH17 was shot down near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine. Australian news media lost interest in the overall ongoing situation after this. I feel I have stepped up to fill this void - or attempted to - however I know I am only one person, and I am doing what I can.

This exhibition is a direct opportunity to share work such as mine in Australia. This exhibition is the first of its kind in Melbourne, and I am unaware of any other exhibition/gallery in Australia that has presented work that solely focuses on the war in Ukraine, the impact of the war on Ukrainian citizens and military volunteers, and the ongoing humanitarian crisis as a result of the war.

Prior to this I have produced two short documentary films about the conflict, one of which a Melbourne-based media company assisted me in editing. My documentary was screened at a local cinema last year to over 200 people, alongside the work of Ukrainian-Australian Stefan Bugryn, who presented his debut documentary film 'War Mothers', which explored the stories of Ukrainian mothers whose sons had been killed in the war.

I will present large (24 x 36 "") colour prints, as well as many smaller prints of black-and-white film photographs. One wall will feature a 1 x 1 meter print from a medium-format negative, displayed in the Moreland Council's 2017 Summer Show, showing a Ukrainian veteran undergoing rehabilitation after being wounded in Ukraine's east. Another wall will display projected video of footage from civilian areas affected by the war and focuses on sound and atmosphere.
4,000,000 Ukrainians living through Russia's war in Donbass
The Frozen Frontline - PLGRM

Any contribution you're able to make directly assists in generating discussion of this issue, and brings attention to the fact it is still happening, and remembers those who have lost their lives to the conflict. I believe that the exhibition will receive media coverage, further amplifying any donations made.

I have met with the large Ukrainian diaspora community in Melbourne and I know they desire coverage and news on the situation. By extension of this project being 'successful' I will be able to continue my work in the future. I hope to continue meeting with serving military, veterans, civilians, NGOs, etc.
What are the risks?
I see this crowdfunding campaign as being low-risk.

This exhibition opens six weeks from the publishing of this crowdfunding campaign. I am in the process of curating works to be printed, and have negotiated reduced rates with two local businesses who will assist me in printing and framing the entirety of the work.

Over the next two weeks I will finalise images and editing, and finalise the exhibition's content, layout, etc. I intend to provide updates for backers of this work. I do not have a product to create or sell, I just need the assistance of those who feel my work has value.
Other ways I can help?

Firstly, thank you for your time if you have made it this far through the campaign's description. I appreciate your time. You can further assist in other ways, and I have outlined some suggestions below:
<ul>
• Research the War in Ukraine's East (including annexation of Crimea), and learn about what has happened/is happening
• Share the crowdfunding campaign page with people you feel may find it interesting
• Contact Ukrainians in Melbourne and let them know the exhibition is happening
• Share details about the exhibition via your social media profiles on the internet
• Write to me if you have any questions, or need my help
• Attend the exhibition in Melbourne when it opens

-

Every contribution helps in making my exhibition a reality. Thank you.

column9: >What is Hybridge Arts Collective?
column25: >Hybridge Arts Collective produces and presents performance pieces that establish new and limitless conversations about the performing arts and redefine the artist and audience relationship within the Greater Philadelphia region. The collective celebrates breaking away from the traditional performing art norms in order to facilitate growth, provide shared resources, and encourage cross-genre appreciation between artists. By presenting a vast number of generative artistic disciplines, they encourage the creation of performance in uncharted forms while simultaneously engaging audiences of far-ranging demographics in the process of art making. Recognizing Philadelphia as one of the nation’s most thriving performing arts communities, Hybridge promises to produce affordable, accessible and captivating work among celebrated and emerging artists.

column1: <div>
<div>

column9: >What is Last Mondays and why should I care about it?
column25: >Last Mondays is a monthly multidisciplinary performing arts series presented at Broad Street Ministries. Since June 2010, the mission of this event is to give performance opportunities to innovative artists and to provide audiences with the most affordable art on the Avenue of the Arts
column41: > For only $5 Last Mondays provides audiences with both a glimpse at emerging work in Philadelphia and a vegetarian pasta dinner. Many forms of the performing arts are incorporated in the Last Mondays series
column58: >music poetry and anything in between. These events bring together an artistic community while providing an opportunity for artists and audiences to have an open dialogue in a space that eliminates artistic elitism.
column74: >Last Mondays is a labor of love that is produced by the five co-directors of Hybridge Arts Collective. Over the last year Last Mondays has hosted 40+ individual artists and performance groups, and has delighted over 250 audience members. Every month Broad Street Ministries opens it doors to Hybridge Arts Collective and its continually growing artist and audience base, for a night of evocative performance art and delicious pasta. This event brings together different artist communities and brings affordable art to the community at large. Last Mondays is an incubator for artists to share their works in progress and polished pieces with their peers and new audiences.

Lighting has been a very special challenge over the past year. Every month Hybridge Arts borrows lighting equipment from a few very generous arts organizations, but if we are able to have our own equipment our lighting capabilities and production value would increase immensely.
