column1: Lindsay Erin Anderson is going to write an orginal song that will give a special dedication to each person that claims the Stone Bridge perk. It will be performed at our Last Mondays Anniversary event and the song will be posted to our websi. No ownership of the song will be given to the donor.

Kelly Turner will choreograph a dance that will be dedicated to all that donated at the Stone Bridge Level. The dance will be performed at our anniversary event and posted on our website. No ownership of the dance will be given to the donor.
column25: >","What is Hybridge Arts Collective?Hybridge Arts Collective produces and presents performance pieces that establish new and limitless conversations about the performing arts and redefine the artist and audience relationship within the Greater Philadelphia region. The collective celebrates breaking away from the traditional performing art norms in order to facilitate growth, provide shared resources, and encourage cross-genre appreciation between artists. By presenting a vast number of generative artistic disciplines, they encourage the creation of performance in uncharted forms while simultaneously engaging audiences of far-ranging demographics in the process of art making. Recognizing Philadelphia as one of the nation’s most thriving performing arts communities, Hybridge promises to produce affordable, accessible and captivating work among celebrated and emerging artists.

column1: What is Last Mondays and why should I care about it?Last Mondays is a monthly multidisciplinary performing arts series presented at Broad Street Ministries. Since June 2010, the mission of this event is to give performance opportunities to innovative artists and to provide audiences with the most affordable art on the Avenue of the Arts. For only $5 Last Mondays provides audiences with both a glimpse at emerging work in Philadelphia and a vegetarian pasta dinner. Many forms of the performing arts are incorporated in the Last Mondays series
column2: including theatre, dance, music poetry and anything in between. These events bring together an artistic community while providing an opportunity for artists and audiences to have an open dialogue in a space that eliminates artistic elitism.Last Mondays is a labor of love that is produced by the five co-directors of Hybridge Arts Collective. Over the last year Last Mondays has hosted 40+ individual artists and performance groups, and has delighted over 250 audience members. Every month Broad Street Ministries opens it doors to Hybridge Arts Collective and its continually growing artist and audience base, for a night of evocative performance art and delicious pasta. This event brings together different artist communities and brings affordable art to the community at large. Last Mondays is an incubator for artists to share their works in progress and polished pieces with their peers and new audiences.

column1: Where does your money go?Your generous donation goes directly into the food, supplies, and marketing needed to create a successful event every month.$1,980 of your donations will go the food costs for an entire year of shows. $1000 of your donations will go to the various technical needs of our monthly show. Including: Clip Lights, Dimmer, Light Bulbs, Gaff Tape, and much much more. Lighting has been a very special challenge over the past year. Every month Hybridge Arts borrows lighting equipment from a few very generous arts organizations, but if we are able to have our own equipment our lighting capabilities and production value would increase immensely.$695 will go to all of our administrative fees. Including: tax preparation, EIN, and incorporation feesHow else can you help?LIKE US: Please like us on Facebook, so you learn more about Last Mondays and other Hybridge Arts Collective Events. APPLY: If you are an performance artist please apply to be a part of Last MondaysATTEND: Come to Last Mondays and bring a friend!JOIN: Our email list and check out our website!
****IMPORTANT INFORMATION ABOUT THE STONE BRIDGE PERK****

Lindsay Erin Anderson is going to write an orginal song that will give a special dedication to each person that claims the Stone Bridge perk. It will be performed at our Last Mondays Anniversary event and the song will be posted to our websi. No ownership of the song will be given to the donor.

Kelly Turner will choreograph a dance that will be dedicated to all that donated at the Stone Bridge Level. The dance will be performed at our anniversary event and posted on our website. No ownership of the dance will be given to the donor.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Short Summary

Hey, Victoria Burners and Art Enthusiasts!

On May 7 in Victoria, we are creating a free, 1-night outdoor Flame Effects demonstration, called the Fire Ball! Wear your tuxes and ball gowns - we'll have ball!

We want to have some music, demonstrations of flame effects, and a fire show! However, to do this we need about $800 to cover event costs.

Event details here:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1021812744579205/

In exchange for your support, we are going to cook up tasty food as a reward, as well as provide some Fire Ball theme buttons (pins).

On the right, check out the campaign perks for the food we're offering!
<i style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Disclosure: about 50% of donation for food rewards will go back to the event. The rest covers the costs. We're hoping that each event attendee will make a minimum $5 donation straight into the event, either as $10 in food rewards or $5 straight up.

column1: If we get more than enough
Extra funds will go to support the artists who participate in this event!

This is an opportunity to get all our friends together at a fairly informal event where we can have fun and enjoy some fire. All it will take is a small donation from the people who are going to attend.

Regardless of whether this fundraiser is successful, we will still host this event. However, your contribution will ensure that Shannon and Ashes don't have to foot the bill!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We are looking for volunteers to be in the fire show

• We need help running the event, please sign up to help:
    http://tinyurl.com/fireballvolunteer
<li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Please get the word out to your friends if you are coming to the event!

","Our Story
Leeds Young Authors (LYA) is a grassroots youth
organisation founded in 2003 in the socially deprived area of Chapeltown,
Leeds, UK.
LYA promotes active literacy, social, political and cultural awareness by
creating spaces to celebrate youth voices, and offers the opportunity for young
people to develop their artistic abilities as confident writers and live
performers across race, class, gender, culture and sexual orientation.
In late July 2011 we hope
to represent Leeds and the UK
in the Brave New Voices (BNV)
International Poetry & Literature Festival – the largest youth event of its
kind this year held in San Francisco.
BNV offers an intensive programme of workshops, seminars and community building
activities and provides an invaluable learning experience for the young people,
poet coaches, educators and mentors alike.
LYA first took part in BNV in 2004 (the first non-American group
invited to do so) and in 2009
our team placed second in the whole poetry Slam competition – an outstanding
achievement considering Leeds was then only one of three teams from outside the US.
Last year funding
cuts meant it was not possible for us to send a full team to BNV and the tragic
death of one of our 2009 team members also impacted the project. Despite these
challenges we are determined to continue nurturing the next generation
of poets and we have recently built upon our success at BNV 2009 by winning the
Word Cup UK National Slam Finals in
With your help we
are now hoping to raise enough money to cover the travel costs and festival
registration for our team to participate in BNV 2011 and to continue the
valuable process of cross-cultural international exchange.
The Impact
Attending
Brave New Voices would offer Leeds Young Authors the chance to connect, dialogue
and build bridges with young artists, educators, poets, and mentors across
radically diverse ethnic, racial, geographic and socio-economic lines. It would
allow us to strengthen the service that we offer to young people in our own
community and to build upon our own annual festival, ‘Voices of a New
Generation’ (the longest running Youth Literature Festival in the UK) which we
have offered free to schools and community groups for the last 8 years.
LYA has offered free literature and creative
writing workshops to dedicated young people aged 13-19 (together with a group for
those aged 11-13) every week for the last 8 years and this huge effort, energy,
enthusiasm and generous time given by our small team of volunteers will be galvanized
once again through engagement with BNV - a one-of-a-kind event.
For the young LYA
poets who have previously attended BNV, the festival has been a life-changing experience:
a source of huge inspiration
dramatic gains in confidence
column2: as well as improved writing, performance and

column1: dialogue skills as a result. On returning to the UK the young poets have also been able
to transmit their experience back to the community and in turn become ambassadors
for the next generation.
The commitment to craft and
growth in the writer and person that BNV encourages is an important and
invaluable experience for all who participate and helps to reinvigorate the
literary continuum and contemporary education through the spoken word: a generation of young people speaking for
themselves, in their own voices.
What We Need & What You Get
We need £6000 (n.b. this site is based in the US so we have
converted amounts to US$, but you can contribute in £ and we will get £).
This amount will cover the travel costs of getting a team of five young poets
together with poetry coach and mentors over to San Francisco, plus travel whilst in the States, plus festival registration fee.
If you can help us out you will receive the immense
satisfaction of contributing to the continuity of a desperately needed (and
free!) grassroots service for young people in a deprived inner-city. Depending
on your contribution you will also receive a flavour of LYA’s award-winning
creativity in the form of: specially crafted printed poetry, recorded poetry, postcards,
limited edition t-shirts, workshops with LYA poets & mentors and an LYA
performance.
BNV has been such an important
developmental link for our organisation (since our founding in 2004) that in the event of us not reaching
our target amount we will still try and send a small representation – this
would include the scenario of sending just three of our team members. If even this proves beyond our means (as it did for the first time last year) then
we would still send one of our past attendees as a BNV
alumni to take part in the highly prestigious Future Corps programme.
We are hoping to raise other money from the volunteer
work that our team contributes and from asking the parents/ guardians of the
young poets to invest in their child’s creative development. We are also holding
fundraising events for the launch of the award-winning We
Are Poets - the film of our journey to BNV in 2008.
Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help
us by spreading the word to your networks (via the share tools) and keeping in
touch with us by joining our group on facebook
and following us on twitter.
Peace & poetry - Leeds Young Authors.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Leeds, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/leeds-young-authors/pica

Je m'appelle Alvaro Pacheco et je suis l'agent qui représente l'artiste peintre Annie Sène.  Quand Annie peint elle entre dans un genre de transe. Son univers est vide de temps, son corps garde un silence discret. Et il lui arrive de sortir de sa transe avec une fatigue sans poids. Et quand elle regarde son oeuvre elle ne comprend pas que c'est vraiment elle qui a exécuté l'oeuvre devant elle.  C'est ainsi que son art l'absorbe.
J'aimerais vous souligner une de ses peintures phares: «Beauté de vie, sans fin».

«Beauté de Vie, sans fin»  n'est pas seulement le titre d'une des peintures d'Annie Sène, mais c'est aussi la philosophie qui empreigne son art. La vie de tous les jours est pleine de beauté. Suffit de garder ses yeux ouverts pour voir cette beauté. Et si par hasard la beauté n'est pas au rendez-vous, il faut la créer. Il faut la puiser au profond de soi-même. Il faut alors la ré-créer à partir des décombres de la réalité.
Vous pouvez voir l'ensemble de l'oeuvre d'Annie : http://www.anniesene.com/loeuvre-dannie-segrave...

Entre deux coups de brosse, entre deux respirations l'horloge ne se force pas. Mais après tous les coups de brosse qui se côtoient sur une toile bien étoffée même l'horloge s'essouffle à donner la cadence.

Entre deux tableaux il existe un bio-ryhtme inaltérable. Le soleil brille. Celui dans les cieux. Pas celui que le peintre sent et voit dans sa transe. Les nuages sont en mouvance diaphane. Les oiseaux peuplent le rebord de la fenêtre dans l'atelier. L'artiste se rend compte qu'il faut mettre victuailles sous dent car sans celles-ci le prochain tableau risque d'être maigre. L'artiste doit aussi payer le loyer de son atelier. Les toiles ne supportent pas ni pluie ni neige.

Pour continuer à pouvoir appuyer cette artiste de grand mérite artistique et d'une belle sensibilité aux vibrations de la vie je fais appel à votre générosité. Chaque contribution est appréciée. Merci!

My name is Alvaro Pacheco and I am the agent of the painter Annie Sène. When Annie paints she goes into a trance. Her universe becomes timeless, and her body becomes discretely present. Sometimes she comes out of her trance with a weightless fatigue. When she looks at her work she asks herself if it was really her who painted the work. Her art absorbs her to this point.
I would like to point out one of her most outstanding paintings. “Beauty of Life, with no end”.

“Beauty of Life, with no end” is not only the title of one of her paintings but it is also the philosophy that pervades her art. Everyday life is full of beauty. Suffices to keep your eyes open to see this beauty. And if perchance beauty fails to present itself before your eyes, you must create it. One must draw it out of oneself. One must re-create beauty from the rubble of reality.
To see all the works of Annie Sène: http://www.anniesene.com/loeuvre-dannie-segrave

In between two brush strokes, in between two respirations the clock does not tire itself. But after all the brush strokes that co-habit on a well filled-out painting the clock is left panting keeping up with the pace. In between two paintings there exists an unalterable bio-rythmn. The sun shines. The one in the sky. Not the one the painter feels and sees in her sate of trance. The clouds are in translucent movement. The birds fill the window sill of the studio. The artist realizes that she must feed herself otherwise her next painting will be quite meagre. The artist must also pay for her studio. Paintings do not tolerate nor snow nor rain.

In order to continue supporting this artist of great artistic merit and beautiful sensitivity to the vibrations of life I am appealing to your generosity. Every contribution is appreciated. Thank you.","Je m'appelle Alvaro Pacheco et je suis l'agent qui représente l'artiste peintre Annie Sène.  Quand Annie peint elle entre dans un genre de transe. A Szenes Klub

A pécsibölcsészek második otthona - itt lépett fel először a Kispál és a Borz - szeretünk itt lenni órák között a többiekkel - benne van valamelyik 30Y számban - ha hétfő akkor...
... nekünk nagyon sokféle a Szenes. Elsődleges találkozási pont, közösségi tér, bulihelyszín ahol nem készülhet partyfotó,  a kedd reggeli hipószag.

Egyet biztosan állíthatunk, hogy ez a PTE BTK-n évtizedek óta működő hivatalos bölcsész Klub.
A mi helyünk. 
Otthon, odú, búvóhely.

2013-as átalakítása óta azonban azt kell mondanunk, szeretett széntárolónk elég  lelketlen és üres.
A gerendák lekerülésének tűzvédelmi és higiéniai oka senkit nem érdekel, mert a bordó-fekete komorság egyszerűen csak ronda.

A mostani kampány célja, hogy kiszínezzük, élettel töltsük fel a Szenest.
Alapvető ötletünk az, hogy Pécset az eddigiekben és jelenleg is meghatározó emblematikus embereket és épületeket stencilezünk a falra. Az arcképcsarnok folyamatosan bővülő és kiegészíthető, a kis karikatúrák pedig beengednek egy keveset a város pszeudomediterrán hangulatából, popkulturális múltjából és jelenéből a bányába.

Mire van szükségünk mindehhez?

Ha nagyon mozgalmira vesszük, akkor azt mondjuk: szükségünk van Rád!
Most azt gondolod, azt mondtuk: szükségünk van a pénzedre!

Mindkettőben van igazság.
Az arculati festéshez cirka 1000 eurónyi összeget (~ 300 000 forint) kell összekalapoznunk. Tartalmazza ez a festékek árát, a festőmanók munkadíját, a külső pavilon térkövezésének költségeit és a grafikák elkészítését.

column5:
>
Felajánlásod azonban nem marad viszonzatlanul!
Cserébe olyan különböző szupercsomagok közül választhatsz, amik minden kisbölcsész egyetemista szívét megdobogtatnák - matricacsomag az új dizájnnal, féléves Szenes támogatói bérlet, pizzakuponok, PécsiBölcsész címlap vagy az altamirai haverkákat messze lepipáló falfestmény-Szenes portré Rólad (vagy akiről csak szeretnéd).

Ezek a csomagok különböző áron vehetők meg - és amellett hogy kúl cuccokhoz jutsz, minket is támogatsz. A felajánlott összeg a Klub üzemeltetőjének bankszámlájára kerül, ő kifizet mindenkit, ti pedig folyamatosan követhetitek, hogy áll a folyamat. Amennyiben nem jön össze a kellő összeg, elkezdjük a festési-felújítási munkánkat, csak lassabb ütemben - ameddig a takarónk ér.

column1:
Hogy lehet mindez ennyire menő??!


Ne feledd, adományozni szexi, és minél többet adsz, annál szexibb leszel. A Szenes is annál szexibb lesz.

Őszintén hiszünk a közösségi finanszírozás erejében, és hisszük azt, hogy nagyobb mosollyal jössz majd le hétfőnként azon a bizonyos lépcsőn abban a tudatban, hogy Te is hozzátettél egy (vagy több) vodkaszódányit.

Egy hónapja megkérdeztünk Titeket, kiket látnátok szívesen a falakon.
A Ti szavazataitok alapján januárban felkerülhet Beck Zoli, a Fishing on Orfű szervezőcsapata, Bagi Zsolt jedi nagymester és a Kerényis padavanok, stb.

Vagy sokkal jobb ötleted van?
Képzeld csak: olyan lesz, amilyennek szeretnéd.
A Szenes mi vagyunk.

Baby if you give it to me I give it to you, I know what you want - és ha Busta Rhymes mondja, tuti így van.
Yeah.

FOR THIS EXHIBITION: 

All of our artists are creating new sculptural works in which the organic and living ingredients in each piece cause a consistent evolution to the works as well as an unpredictability and guaranteed expiration. Throughout this process, the living works are interacting with each other, reacting to and feeding off of the atmosphere each is creating. Battling, negotiating and co-creating an environment. Rather than entering a gallery and seeing a product of marble or canvas, we are confronting a composite not unlike our own, and like the human condition, in a state of impermanence. This deliberate mortality leads us to consider how we can interpret the meaning of value when an art work guarantees an expiration date.

YOUR SUPPORT:

In order to make this project possible we are asking for your help in whatever amount you can afford and sharing with anyone you think might be interested in supporting our project. 100% of donations will go towards promoting and supporting the artists through their production costs. Please feel free to refer to the graph below to get an overview of how the funds will be distributed. We have several offerings as tokens of our gratitude including, socks, caps and limited-edition zines featuring editioned artist prints with edible ink on edible paper so even if you can’t make the exhibition you can still experience the artwork!

 

THE ARTISTS:

 

BIANCA BONDI (B. 1986) RSA

click here for more info

Bianca Bondi creates large-scale installations combining natural or manmade physical remnants with raw substances and chemicals. Bondi also explores the properties that various cultures ascribe to physical materials and how these beliefs dialogue with contemporary life. Her recent solo shows include Repressed Memories Return As Myths... at la Cité des Sciences, Paris
column2:
Gradually then Suddenly, Galerie 22,48m2, Paris SWEETTEETH, Hazard Gallery, South Africa. She has been shortlisted three times for Fondation François Schneider’s talents contemporains and was included in the seminal exhibition, Crashtest: La Révolution Moléculaire curated by Nicolas Bourriaud, La Panacée, Montpellier.

 

MIMOSA ECHARD (B. 1986) FR

click here for more info!

Mimosa Echard collects and assembles dead and living matter, playing on both an illusion of living and the skilful dosage of poisons and their antidotes. She is the co-founder of Turpentine Magazine with Jean Luc Blanc and Jonathan Martin, and of the Kombucha Project Centre, in collaboration with Michel Blazy. Her recent solo shows include FRIENDS, galerie Samy Abraham, Paris and Pulsion Potion, Cell Project Space, London. Echard was also included in Le Rêve des Formes, Palais de Tokyo, Paris
column3: Pre-Capital, curated by Nicolas Bourriaud, La Panacée, Montpellier
column4: The Plates of the Present, So Far, Praz-Delavallade, Paris
column5:
and Faisons de l’inconnu un allié, Lafayette Anticipation, Paris.

 

THE KOMBUCHA PROJECT

The Kombucha Project is a residency program that Mimosa Echard co created with artist Michel Blazy in which they invite artists to elaborate on an ever-developing artwork. Experimenting with the fermented tea, the artists negotiate the tea’s properties by introducing objects to the ever-growing skin like film created from the liquid, resulting in a collage of both the familiar and unrecognisable.

 

AGATA INGARDEN (B. 1994) PL

click here for more info

Agata Ingarden’s work presents a collision of fabricated industrial structures embedded in thick amorphous substance made of burnt sugar. The figures she makes are both intrusive to the environment, presenting an obstacle to the landscape, while simultaneously having its form dictated by elements of the environment such as temperature and gravity. Working in installation, sculpture and video, Ingarden uses her work to explore the precarious distinction between fiction and reality, and contemporary belief systems. Her recent solo shows include Sweaty Hands, Exo Exo, Paris. Other exhibitions she participated in includes Connecting Vessels, Galeria Bunkier Sztuki, Krakow
column9:
BATHROOM/ BATHHOUSE, with Irina Jasnowski, MX Gallery, New York and Today I brushed my teeth, Cooper Union, New York.

 

LAURE VIGNA (B. 1984) FR

click here for more info

Laure Vigna’s work presents a contradiction of materials by corrupting the primary biological value of food inedible synthetic substances. The infected organic matter poses drama in its temporality and provokes questions of preservation. Her recent solo shows include: In between North &
column10: South, I melt away, Πνεûμα, Lisbon and Le cru et le cuit, Mon Chéri, Brussels. Other shows she participated in include Season Finale, Belvédère, “Programme Suite” initiated by the CNAP, Lieu-Commun, Toulouse, FR
column11:
Panorama de la jeune création, 6th Biennial of contemporary art, Pavillon d’Auron, Bourges and Never ending object, curated by Ann Guillaume, Cité internationale des Arts, Paris.

 

WHERE AND WHEN:

Our exhibition is set to take place in Paris on the 29th of June at the artist run space DOC as a two-part exhibition alongside a show curated by artist Daiga Grantina. DOC is a not-for-profit artist run organisation in Paris that fosters the sharing of artistic ideas, knowledge, and techniques with an aim to promoting and spreading contemporary creation. Doc enables both young and experienced artists and artisans to work and share ideas.

WHO WE ARE:

We are four master students completing an MBA in Contemporary Art in Paris that have been working on an exhibition as part of our graduation. Coming from china, South Africa and the United States, our educational backgrounds are in Fine Arts, Industrial Design and Language. This exhibition will be executed in partnership with IESA and EOS.

THANK YOU for your generous support!
Jiaxi Chen, Margueritte Krüger, Lucie Touroul and Zhenni Wu

column20: Panorama de la jeune création, 6th Biennial of contemporary art, Pavillon d’Auron, Bourges and Never ending object, curated by Ann Guillaume, Cité internationale des Arts, Paris. WHERE AND WHEN:Our exhibition is set to take place in Paris on the 29th of June at the artist run space DOC as a two-part exhibition alongside a show curated by artist Daiga Grantina. DOC is a not-for-profit artist run organisation in Paris that fosters the sharing of artistic ideas, knowledge, and techniques with an aim to promoting and spreading contemporary creation. Doc enables both young and experienced artists and artisans to work and share ideas.WHO WE ARE:We are four master students completing an MBA in Contemporary Art in Paris that have been working on an exhibition as part of our graduation. Coming from china, South Africa and the United States, our educational backgrounds are in Fine Arts, Industrial Design and Language. This exhibition will be executed in partnership with IESA and EOS.THANK YOU for your generous support!Jiaxi Chen, Margueritte Krüger, Lucie Touroul and Zhenni Wu",9.0,0,"1 Campaign

Introducing the Soul Cube: The ultimate aromatherapy diffuser hand-crafted from solid black walnut.

Drop your favorite scent onto the top of the diffuser. Our hand-crafted solid walnut diffuser keeps the scent subtle and fresh for days.

At Rhine Valley, we are experts in handmade woodcraft. Our Soul Cube is a handcrafted solid piece of Black Walnut. Get in touch with nature and take your soul on a relaxing trip anytime with our aromatherapy diffuser. 

Black walnut is corrosion resistant, won't crack or deform and is a preferred wood of royalty. The famous black walnut desk in the palace of Versalles is still in perfect shape after hundreds of years!

Expert hand carving makes each cube unique.

Black walnut has a rich, microporous structure, perfect for diffusing essential oils evenly and slowly over time.

Each size will have a unique grain due to the natural structure of the wood and the handmade diffuser at the top.

The Soul Cube can fit into your lifestyle, no matter where you work, live or play!

Our Soul Cube wood diffuser is an eco-freindly alternative to aromatherapy candles and electronic aromatherapy machines: No batteries, no CO2 emissions. and a more natural scent．

Be more productive at work with scents like Lemon, Lavender, Jasmine, Rosemary, Cinnamon or Peppermint.

Relax at home with scents like Rose, Vetiver, Ylang Ylang, Bergamot or Chamomile.

Stay alert in the car with scents like Orange Oil, Eucalyptus, Cedarwood or Grapefruit.

Lose weight with appetite supressant scents like Ginger or Sandalwood.

Take the Soul Cube with you anywhere with the included travel bag.

Thank you so much for reading! Please back the campaign and help us bring the Soul Cube to life!

ABOUT ME and MY BOOK
Hello.  My name is Richard Orton and I want to share
my remarkable photographic journey with you.
Years ago I became aware
of a world I did not know existed, and it captured my imagination.  I went down the rabbit hole!  I met some remarkable people there, and they
changed my life.  Had I not found this
world, much of what is now my life would not have been revealed to me.
A little over
twenty-five years ago I visited a small community in northwest Nacogdoches
County in deep East Texas.  That
community, known as County Line, began in the 1870’s when three former slaves,
the Upshaw brothers, Guss, Felix, and Jim, settled there. They and other newly
emancipated blacks moved there and raised families on land they owned, farmed,
and otherwise used to support themselves. They did this at a time when Jim Crow
ruled the lives of most blacks throughout the South.  Descendants of these pioneers still live in
County Line.  It is one of many similar
communities in East Texas and throughout the South.  Would you help me make this little known, but
important, part of American history more visible and appreciated?  Would you join my dream?
During the last twenty-five
years I have photographed daily life in County Line and learned a lot about its
history.  Now I am making a book
containing more than 50 duotone photographs and text from community members conveying the contemporary experience of
growing up in a “freedom colony.”
WHAT WE NEED and WHAT YOU GET
It really helps that the
University of North Texas Press has already agreed to publish the book in the Fall of 2014!  Yes, really!
So why do I need your
support?
Printing high quality
photographs, known as duotones, is more expensive than normal printing.  As an academic press, UNT Press has budgetary
limitations.  So they’ve asked me to
raise additional funds. That’s where you come in.
I’m setting our goal at
If you decide to help
me, you will be rewarded.  I’m offering
several exhibition quality prints from the book, a production credit printed in
the book, and, of course, a signed copy of the book itself.  See the “Perks” section for details.
The Impact
Our American history
books have neglected the story of communities like County Line. Known as
“freedom colonies,” their importance in the lives of African-Americans after
slavery ended deserves to be better known.
They provided opportunities for African-Americans to have better, more
independent lives than most other newly freed slaves.  Your contribution to my book will help
correct this mistake.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are not able
to contribute financially you can still help by getting the word out to people
you know who might be interested in contributing.  You can use the share tools located below the

video.

Hello.....I'M ARTIST RICHARD ARTHUR!
<div>

I am a California based artist who seeks to change the course of modern art.  It has been my fondest dream to create an artshow celebrating the great supermodels and be able to share the work with them.  On a recent trip to London, Kate Moss walked right up to me and asked me who I was.  When I said, ""The painter Richard Arthur..it's wonderful to meet you!"",  her eyes widened and she replied...""OH..that Richard!""  It was a very special moment. Once i got home to the US I knew I had to craft something...not just an artshow, but a new way of thinking about everything...I couldn't work in a boutique any longer, for now was the time to invent the dream and soar headlong into my true purpose. I created an artshow that I plan to debut during New York Fashion Week, and eventually go international beginning with London, then Paris and so on. The show will celebrate a new and unique beauty icon hand picked from the world of fashion and the event will take place annually.  I plan to paint Kate Moss, Lara Stone and Carmen Kass to name a few....Your contribution will help me to realize a stunning vision I dreamed up where large scale portraits will be adorned with neon tubing that is sure to light up a space in a remarkable and exciting way.....you have the chance to be part of Art History!
<div>
Your contribuition will ultimately aid in a charitable donation..
I am thrilled to see how much I can raise toward realizing the electronic aspect of this project and cannot wait to share this vision with the world.

With the support of my supermodel friends, I plan to align each show with a charity of the choosing of each model.  The debut show will feature Carmen Kass and a portion of the profits recieved from the show will be donated to a charity of her choosing. This allows me to create my dream and also affords me the ability to affect some positive change and provide people some assistance.
<div>
Tell a friend!
If you can't contribute to the fund...you can share this campaign with your friends!

The Lighthouse Mural Project:

My name is Julio Romero, and I am a senior at Lighthouse Community Charter High School in Oakland, CA.  I've been an artist my whole life, and it's been a huge part of my high school career.  This is my last year, and I want to leave a positive, lasting impression on my school and the neighborhood.  My goal is to paint a mural on an unused school wall.  Other art students have done murals in the past, and I want to continue this tradition by making a mural using my personal artistic style.

That's where you come in.  In order to create the mural, I need materials (such as an air brush, paint and plywood) that I can't afford.  My school doesn't have enough in the art budget to make this project happen.  By supporting this project, you are helping:
-Me to improve my art skills and better prepare me for my future in art.
-Improve a school in urban Oakland
-Continue a tradition of mural painting at my school

If you support the project, you'll receive a piece of my original artwork in the same style as the proposed mural.  Depending on what you give, this could be anything from a sticker to a framed, signed piece.

How much do I need?

My funding goal is $750.00.  This will cover my materials and labor cost.  Here's what I need for the project:
Airbrush Kit (compressor and tips)
Paint (black and white):
Brushes
Plywood
Airbrush paint (various colors)
Paint markers

Clear coat (to keep mural intact) 

Spray paint
If you can't donate money to this project, I will also accept donations of materials that I can use to finish the project.

Why a Mural?

This project is extremely important to me.  I have plans for a career in art, and being able to practice my airbrush skills will get me closer to this goal.  The mural will let me leave something behind for other Lighthouse students to see once I graduate.  I also feel that this project will improve my school and neighborhood and make it a more beautiful place.
I
column5: > am dedicating this mural to the Head of our school, Mr. Sexton, who is currently battling cancer.  Your donations will help me to reach these goals, and create a great mural.

column1: kim? Contemporary
Art Centre together with Berlin based Latvian curator Kaspars Vanags (curator of the Latvia's National pavilion at Venice Art Biennale 2015) and with support by Gary
Everett (founder and current artistic director at Homotopia Liverpool and an official representative of Tom of Finland Foundation in Europe) is organizing the first art
exhibition in Latvia dedicated to queer issues featuring new and recent art
works from international and local contemporary artists as well as museum
worthy display of Tom of Finland and Edgars Ozoliņš. The exhibition will be
accompanied with a parallel program of talks and performances. Exhibition shall
open on June 18th during EuroPride 2015 events in Riga.
is the first country in the territory of former Soviet Union to host EuroPride and this exhibition will
definitely draw a lot of attention as the activities have already received an aggressive response both from general public, mass media as well as politicians. <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >But we believe that our team with your support

column1: will be able to execute the project at the highest level.
Tom of Finland (1944-1990, FI/USA), Aleesa
Cohena (Canada), Zackary Drucker and Rhys Ernst (USA), Lucas Foletto Celinski (BR/DE), Atis
Jākobsons (LV), Matthew Lutz Kinoy (USA), Inga Meldere (LV/FI),
Vladislavs Nastavševs (LV), Benny Nemerofsky Ramsay (Canada), Armīns
Ozoliņš (LV), Edgars Ozoliņš (1930-1987, LV), Karol Radziszewski (PL), Wolfgang Tillmans

(DE), Vilnis Vējš  (LV).


The concept
social acceptance and gay rights or their absence in the present Latvia, this
project follows an idea about the universalising view on sexual identity and desire
questioning previously dominant model of binary oppositions (male/female,
homosexual/heterosexual) and the open-source mentality of the later concepts of
queer sexuality, “third sex”, etc.
Avoiding any presumptions that certain
individuals are truly born gay and only those born with the ""deviant""
traits share an interest in them, this project stresses that homosexuality is
important to persons with a wide range of sexualities, as there is no such a
thing as a stable erotic identity, and everyone is to some degree queer in
their inherent qualities of mind and character, even if not in their physical
behavior.
The iconic figure of Tom of Finland serves as a
platform to question the stereotypes of sexuality, gender and idealized body. To
name few other participants: exhibition would also include collaborative work
of American artist couple Zackary Drucker and Rhys
Ernst. Last summer (2014), they hit a high point in their careers by being
included in the Whitney Biennial. Their photo series ""Relationship"" will be shipped from LA.
The Longest Day of the Year (Relationship). Courtesy of Luis De Jesus Los Angeles
Exhibition will bring in a juxtaposition
between Tom of Finland's works and Latvian artist <b>Edgars
Ozoliņš, whose photorealistic and overtly sexualized illustrations of teen
novels from the 1960s – 1980s encouraged the soviet-time public discourse on
sexuality. By illustrating a scandalous (and exceedingly homophobic) book on
sex and marriage, the artist succeeded to, for the first time in soviet
history, create a set of drawings depicting a vast variety of sexual
postures.
With various invited speakers (among them
German photographer Wolfgang Tillmans, Latvian and foreign poets,
theoreticians, historians) the synchronous talks will question the concepts
behind the exhibition ideas through talks, presentations, and more.
<div>
are approximately 45’000 EUR, where more than a half is production expenses and
shipping costs.
will help us to cover expenses related to the production of the exhibition,
including shipping expenses of the original art works from Los Angeles, USA, and various European cities, to
ensure the public program as
well as to keep the exhibition open for the public.
What exactly your contribution does?
30 EUR will help us to execute one guided tour, 50 EUR will help us to securely
ship the works for 90 km (did you know that it is 9300 km from Los Angeles to
Riga?). Even
more – your 100 EUR will help us to frame one artwork in the exhibition. If you
can afford – 250 EUR will help us to keep the exhibition open for one day.
In appreciation to your generous contribution
you will receive a great reward – please see the list on right.

column4:
>CG Hubs is an indie community of CG artists, designers and painters.

What is CG Hubs?

Note: We will be using our Indiegogo funds, if the campaign is successful, to purchase a dedicated server, an SSL certificate and pay for them in advance for 5 years. We also want to hire two editors to write industry related articles and to launch weekly and monthly challenges. We also want to hire an art moderator, to fight spam and better organize art visibility on the homepage.

CG Hubs is an indie community of CG artists, designers and painters. It is not supposed to replace any other community, instead it offers an alternative. While the name is similar to another community, now closed, it is not meant to replace it or to copy it. Our community is built on open-source software and bespoke modules, uniquely built for our purposes.

We worked for 3 months to build an easy to use system and to offer artists, designers and painters maximum exposure and visibility.

The site is in beta state and it's available on http://cghubs.com/.

How does it work?

As an artist, you simply create a hub account and start uploading images. It's that simple. You have the possibility to enhance your profile and make it stand out from the crowd by using cover images, custom avatars, additional profile information, contact details, hiring availability and more.

You can tag your uploaded images, mark them as work in progress, request critique or finished, make them available for printing and more. 

Based on artist feedback, we will add new features, tags, categories and image properties on a regular basis.

Is it free?

Yes. There are no premium profiles, no pro members and no paid features. It's free and it will always be free. Artists, designers and painters will earn points and badges based on their implication and involvement. This includes uploading images, commenting, giving feedback and improving the profile. Moreover, certain events, challenges or contests will allow them to earn badges. The more points and badges a user has, the higher he/she will rank.

Are there any limitations?

There are no limitations. There are no paid features. There are no obtrusive ads, all advertisement will be CG related and it will provide funds for the community. Ideally, we want to have contests and challenges with hardware/peripherals prizes, such as mice, tablets, drawing pads, software licenses and more.

We have a transparency policy and all new features will be voted and vetoed by our users.

The site is privately owned. We are also looking for sponsors and investors.

User types

Based on points or badges, users will differentiate and become bronze, silver or gold without having to pay.

Feature requests

If any user wants a certain feature, either from another site or completely unique, we will implement it in less than two weeks. We are open to all requests and we want to maintain a happy community.

Why Indiegogo?

This Indiegogo campaign is meant to purchase dedicated servers and pay for them in advance for several years. Also, the funds will be used to hire moderators, administrators and a QA team.

Who am I?

I'm a happy daddy!

I’m also a PHP/SQL developer with advanced knowledge of database administration and optimization. I’m a web programmer - backend and frontend - with over 13 years of professional experience in the web industry.

Interests include game development, travel, photography and movie-making. Also, matte painting, CG design and cinematography.

Who are the other team members?

We have 4 artists on board, 1 painter, 6 more confirmed and one moderator.

What features are we aiming for?

Construction on these book projects is well underway. This leaves me with a quandary: I still have a bull costume perk that needs to be claimed! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be a contributor to this huge project, jump right into my queue and get a costume long before I will be open again, AND to get a costume that will be instantly recognized by a significant portion of the costuming community! As always, SHIPPING IS INCLUDED IN ALL PERKS FOR EVERYONE, even international shipping!

These additional funds will be put toward the cost of making even more video tutorials, acquiring more equipment/supplies, and research and development projects, including animatronics supplies, new materials to test, education materials, and the time involved in testing novel materials and concepts, along with covering the additional fees and taxes that come with receiving these funds. I have already begun doing some of this R&
column2:
D, and have some new tricks for the book because of it!


I've blown past some of my goals already! Here's what I'm doing past my original project concept as bonuses:


All head blanks from the ""Gryphon"" tier will come cut and hinged!


All funders that contributed before the Deadline Funding period ended will be getting additional goodies! All mailed perk items will come with magnets, stickers, buttons, or all of the above. ""Crow"" tier PDF backers will also receive 'The Art of Mordrude's Monster Manual' bonus PDF. ""Wolf"" tier backers will receive a link to download my video tutorials. Finally, I've created a new perk (""Chimera"") exclusively available to any backer who contributed before the Deadline Funding period ended, featuring a handmade pendant!
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

My first stretch goal is being celebrated by an assortment of basic video tutorials! The one linked above is the very first one completed, and should serve as a great teaser for things to come. These will include methods such as: eye painting and gluing, making silicone molds for claws/jawsets, making Ultracal molds for pawpads, making 2-part Ultracal molds for tongues, molding horns, urethane resin pours (claws/jawset casting), casting silicone noses/pawpads, rotocasting resin horns, rotocasting resin bases, airbrushing, patterning a head with a moving jaw, patterning paws/hands, and whatever else I can come up with that deserves some action shots!

column1:
I’m Sarah “Mordrude” Wilson, and I’ve been creating fur costumery for over a dozen years, the last five of those professionally. I've had my work featured in galleries with Hollywood professionals, highlighted by the local media, and ran a yearly auction benefiting my local no-kill shelter. Throughout this time I've been making tutorials and updating them when I find easier, more economical, or more effective techniques to help others realize their own dreams of bringing their inner monster to life. 

I believe I have! I’ve seen these tutorials shared frequently on messageboards, and have allowed their use in con panels across the globe. I frequently receive comments of gratitude for offering these, and it’s extremely rewarding to know I’ve been able to help others achieve their dreams, whether that may be bringing their beloved characters to life, or giving other aspiring novices the tools and knowledge to improve the quality of the costumes they offer. I have been asked multiple times to go further in depth, but there's a limit on how much info I can pack into an image designed to be easy to share without making the images or text illegible. There's also the matter of the time and effort that goes into making these, which is time and effort I lose out on by not working on projects that pay the bills, as I do this for a living.

Suddenly, I came upon a solution to both of my qualms: why not a tutorial book - a monster manual of sorts? I can share more in-depth tips, tricks, and tutorials along with bits on design and theory with less worry of everything being fragmented, and I can have some recompense for my time and efforts. Plus, I'd get to have my name on a book! How awesome is that?

So I started planning! I looked back at my different tutorials, tips, tricks, and treatises on shaping, and added the multitudes of tutorials people have been asking for that I've not yet done due to constraints such as time, money, materials, and equipment. Tutorials like:
• Patterning and sewing fur, including darts and hoods
• How to achieve realistic texture on pawpads, noses, and tongues
• How to hinge and articulate a moving jaw
• How to mold, cast, and attach removable horns
• Molding a jawset from a real skull
• Creating digitigrade and unguligrade padding
• Installation of eyes and eyelids that have depth and expressiveness
• And so much more I need a book to contain it all!

I don't expect to retire because this book tops the bestseller lists. In fact, in addition to the physical rendition of this vast repository of costume building knowledge, I will be making the final version of the Monster Manual available in PDF form for $10. In addition, I will also condense most (but not all!) tutorials into my standard bare-bones image format and post these for free on my website, as I always have. In this way, virtually everyone will be able to benefit from this project!

Best of all, I'll get to create three costumes for three supportive fans! These will be my only queue openings until this is finished, so if you want a costume that is made to size from me before 2018 this is your chance!

Whether you’re preparing to build your very first costume, or are a seasoned pro looking to improve their work, or are just curious what goes into making realistic creature costumes, I've aimed to provide useful and interesting content for aspiring artists and fans alike. 


So please, if you've used my tutorials in the past and benefited from them, consider chipping in what you can to make this happen - you'll not just be helping me, you'll be helping raise the bar for the world of animal costuming!


All of the supplies and equipment for the book projects have been ordered and are here! I have already finished my new Duct Tape Dummy (DTD) tutorial, and released the free version to the masses. Next in line is the foot  DTD tutorial photoshoot, and then I can send along the materials for making DTDs to my costume tier backers!

Anticipated start date on these costumes is the second week of February. Production time on this batch of costumes and all the tutorial photography I'm estimating at about nine months, and the book compilation I anticipate to take an additional three months on top of that. My goal is an early 2016 book launch!

I am the only person capable of doing the work needed to fulfill this project, so if I have a catastrophic injury or are otherwise incapacitated, delays will occur. Life happens, but I have a consistent track record of completing my projects or reimbursing people, no matter what it takes. This project means a lot to me, and I will do everything in my power to make it go off without a hitch, but you can rest assured that I will follow through and make this worthwhile to every supporter!


Even if you can't contribute financially, you absolutely can still help! Believe it or not, there are still people who haven't heard of my Monster Manual, so sharing a link here on your social media sites helps your friends, me, and the whole costume making community connect to make the most of this opportunity. You can use the handy share buttons at the bottom of this page.

 If you are running a fursuit-related panel at a convention, you can help even more by mentioning my project!

 “When a few hundred of us collectively choose to feel feelings that create harmony and coherence in our hearts, the energy of those emotions radiate outward from our heart and reverberate throughout the planet, generating enough energy to alleviate suffering, pain, and disease for thousands.”
My name is Christina Del Gallo. I am an artist, and a healer. My art evolves from the dictates of my heart.
Connecting as many people as I can to the healing power of their heart has always been my life's work.
I do this by creating and sharing beautiful HealingHearts, created out of my passion to spread love, beauty, and the healing energy of the heart throughout the world.
Before I explain the nature and purpose of the Have-a-Heart, Give-a-Heart project I'd like to share with you why I chose the heart as my artistic medium…
WHAT'S SO IMPORTANT ABOUT THE HEART?
Did you know that...
Your Heart Is The Most Powerful Organ Of Your Body?
It's a scientific fact: Your heart is 5000 times more powerful than your brain.
And did you know that your heart, mine and everyone’s on the planet, is the strongest generator of electrical and magnetic fields?
Which, amazingly, means that...
We are born with the power to harmonize our bodies with the magnetic fields of the earth.
And how about this beautiful fact?...
The pulse of your heart beats at  the same rate as the pulse of the universe!
Which means, that...
As long as your heart is beating, you are inseparably connected to the universe, and to every other heart on the planet!
So what do those facts have to do with the Have A Heart Give A Heart project I would like to share with the world?
EVERYTHING!
Let me explain…

HealingHearts are made with the finest silks and velvets and filled with premium quality, luscious organic lavender––known for its rejuvenating properties––and finished with an endless supply of love radiating from my heart.
But what’s most magical about my HealingHearts is that once they’re completed they take on a life of their own. They become imbued with a transformative healing energy.
I know this to be true because I have been creating these hearts for many years and I have witnessed first-hand, and been told by hundreds, that the hearts manifest a distinct healing power.

Each heart I give to someone magically synchronizes with that person’s actual heart, generating exactly the life-enhancing  
healing energy the person needs.
Pretty amazing, don’t you think?
TO SUCCEED THIS PROJECT NEEDS YOUR ENERGY!
Okay, so now that you know why I chose the heart as my medium let me share with you what the Have A Heart, Give A Heart project is all about…
Have A Heart, Give A Heart is to be an interactive, collaborative, pay-it-forward project--a collaboration of shared heart energy––from my heart to yours, from your heart to another’s.
At the heart of the project is a deep felt desire to help the world––you, me and everyone else––shift to a new, heartfelt, life-affirming, cooperative, compassionate community.
A world in which we open our hearts and fall in love—with ourselves and with everyone else.
To succeed, Have A Heart, Give A Heart needs your heart energy, and the shared heart energy of a few hundred others.
Together, you and the others who join in this effort, will become HealingHeart Donors, generating a massive entrainment of thousands of hearts.
Here's how...
In 3 months time, September, October, November 2012, I will create 333 HealingHearts,
I chose the number 333 because the number three and the number 9 are cosmologically hugely significant.
They are spiritually the most powerful numbers.
Not only is 3 the mystical power number that throughout history has instilled love, peace, and compassion, it is also particularly significant to this year, 2012.
As you know, the Mayan calendar predicts the end of the world, as we know it, will occur on 12-21-12.
Notice that those numbers add up to 333!
Well, I am certain the world is definitely not going to end on 12-21-12!
However, our actions and behaviors during the remaining months of 2012 are profoundly important.
It is critical that we amass the healing energy of our hearts to revitalize and shepherd in a new era of time.
<ul>
• A time when hate no longer exists.
• A time when the energy of compassion and love vibrate in everyone’s heart.
• A world in which we think with our hearts
Through a communion of hearts we will help usher in a one-for-all and all-for-one sensibility. Our beating hearts pulsating with peace and love.
With your collaboration, Have A Heart, Give A Heart, in its small way, will help to engender this new sensibility.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
Have A Heart, Give A Heart will be overwhelmingly effective if you, and at least 333 others, pledge your commitment to share your heart and the energy of HealingHearts with others.
You do that by donating to the project and in return you receive one or more HealingHearts.
Which you then gift to someone else!
<ul>
• Gift a HealingHeart to a dear soul whose heart longs to be opened.
• Share a heart with a loved one, friend or child who is ill. Imbue her with the healing power of your heart and a HealingHeart.
• Gift a heart to a loved one to celebrate your heart connection.
• Offer a heart as balm to he who is suffering from a broken heart.  Anyone suffering from emotional or physical pain.
• Share a heart with a lonely heart, or a person who needs forgiving.

Your gesture of gifting a HealingHeart and opening your heart to others will entrain your heart with someone else’s heart and synchronize with the heart energy of all the combined hearts creating one very powerful heart healing force!
While you’re at it, be sure you gift yourself a heart!

To get the maximum benefit of your HealingHeart place it where it is readily accessible. Reflect on it every day. Caress it. Smell it. Hold it close to your heart. Meditate on it. Sleep with it.   Your HealingHeart will open your heart to feelings of gratitude, forgiveness, compassion, love, and joy... constantly reminding you that the pulsing of your heartbeat is miraculously synchronized to the heartbeat of the universe.

“When we choose to feel feelings that create harmony and coherence in our hearts––gratitude, compassion, forgiveness––the energy of those emotions extend outward and positively affect thousands of others.”
Whatever your level of participation, you will be an energetic part of Have A Heart, Give A Heart. Everyone can participate at some level. See the Rewards for particulars.
In addition to creating the hearts I am also going to put up a Website and a blog where we can all participate in sharing experiences with our heart and the hearts we gifted to others.
The URL will be: www.HaveAHeartGiveAHeart.com. Whatever your level of participation, you will be honored on the Website as a HealingHeart Donor.
My hope is that the Website and blog will continue indefinitely as a conduit for releasing wholehearted, expansive heart energy.

And my further hope is that everyone participating in this project, in whatever way, will share their HealingHeart experience on the blog and with one another, so that all our hearts are joined through the energy of cyberspace.
“What we choose to experience in our lives  we must first feel in our hearts as if it has already happened.”
The way I see it, the Have A Heart, Give A Heart project has already happened. It is merely waiting for your energy to make it bloom, and for space and time to catch up.
Together, let us pay homage to the wisdom and universal power of the heart.
“I open my heart to what it knows best, which is to love, and let go of the rest.”
Wholeheartedly,

Christina Del Gallo 
San Francisco, California

A time when hate no longer exists.
A time when the energy of compassion and love vibrate in everyone’s heart.
A world in which we think with our hearts
Through a communion of hearts we will help usher in a one-for-all and all-for-one sensibility. Our beating hearts pulsating with peace and love.
With your collaboration, Have A Heart, Give A Heart, in its small way, will help to engender this new sensibility.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
Have A Heart, Give A Heart will be overwhelmingly effective if you, and at least 333 others, pledge your commitment to share your heart and the energy of HealingHearts with others.
You do that by donating to the project and in return you receive one or more HealingHearts.
Which you then gift to someone else!
Gift a HealingHeart to a dear soul whose heart longs to be opened.
Share a heart with a loved one, friend or child who is ill. Imbue her with the healing power of your heart and a HealingHeart.
Gift a heart to a loved one to celebrate your heart connection.
Offer a heart as balm to he who is suffering from a broken heart.  Anyone suffering from emotional or physical pain.
Share a heart with a lonely heart, or a person who needs forgiving.

Your gesture of gifting a HealingHeart and opening your heart to others will entrain your heart with someone else’s heart and synchronize with the heart energy of all the combined hearts creating one very powerful heart healing force!
While you’re at it, be sure you gift yourself a heart!

To get the maximum benefit of your HealingHeart place it where it is readily accessible. Reflect on it every day. Caress it. Smell it. Hold it close to your heart. Meditate on it. Sleep with it.   Your HealingHeart will open your heart to feelings of gratitude, forgiveness, compassion, love, and joy... constantly reminding you that the pulsing of your heartbeat is miraculously synchronized to the heartbeat of the universe.

“When we choose to feel feelings that create harmony and coherence in our hearts––gratitude, compassion, forgiveness––the energy of those emotions extend outward and positively affect thousands of others.”
Whatever your level of participation, you will be an energetic part of Have A Heart, Give A Heart. Everyone can participate at some level. See the Rewards for particulars.
In addition to creating the hearts I am also going to put up a Website and a blog where we can all participate in sharing experiences with our heart and the hearts we gifted to others.
The URL will be: www.HaveAHeartGiveAHeart.com. Whatever your level of participation, you will be honored on the Website as a HealingHeart Donor.
My hope is that the Website and blog will continue indefinitely as a conduit for releasing wholehearted, expansive heart energy.

And my further hope is that everyone participating in this project, in whatever way, will share their HealingHeart experience on the blog and with one another, so that all our hearts are joined through the energy of cyberspace.
“What we choose to experience in our lives  we must first feel in our hearts as if it has already happened.”
The way I see it, the Have A Heart, Give A Heart project has already happened. It is merely waiting for your energy to make it bloom, and for space and time to catch up.
Together, let us pay homage to the wisdom and universal power of the heart.
“I open my heart to what it knows best, which is to love, and let go of the rest.”
Wholeheartedly,
Christina Del Gallo San Francisco, California",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","San Francisco, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/haveaheartgiveaheart-christina-del-gallo/pica

This year, I started a poster company called Shmexy Posters LLC. Our goal is to help models and photographers get the recogniton that they deserve for all their hard work and effort. No one should have to work for free.

With our official company launch on August 1st, we wanted to give our loyal customers a special treat to thank them for being so patient while we get our business off the ground. It's time to move our printing in house, lower our prices, and roll out a new product.
<div>

The funds that we receive will be used to get our first ever printed calendars produced in time to be distributed for the 2013 year, and provide the marketing and incentive costs to promote the visibility of our calendars (as well as the purchase of materials that we'll need). We're looking at paper, ink, paying our models and photographers and marketing our product. We've put a lot of time into figuring out what it's going to take to reach our goal, which is why you see that funny number, $3037, because that's EXACTLY how much we need to pull this off!
All of our models work super hard and deserve a little bit of recognition for all the time and effort they put into their craft.
<div>

Even if you can't contribute, you can let people know about this project. Please share this page, spread the word, and utilize the power of social networking to get everyone we possibly can on board. Every dollar and every share makes a difference!
Just a reminder - All of your potential rewards can be viewed at https://www.facebook.com/shmexyposters in their ""Inventory"" album.

<h3 style=""text-align: center

Hello!
My name is Brianna Wines (Silvixen). I am an Australian artist and one of the contributors for the collaborative charity art project, Artists for the Amazon. Together, over fifty artists from more than twelve countries have set aside their time, passion and skills to create a collection of stunning artwork in response to the 2019 Amazon Rainforest fires. After these devastating fires many of us were asking what we could do to help our beloved environments and wildlife, especially those who didn't have a lot of money to donate and who lived far away. The answer soon became apparent that we could give up our time and use what talents we had to create an incentive for others to help us help them.
We worked to reach out to the public, seeking additional artists to contribute and have put together a second collection, the contest magazine, to show off their work and passion as well.

These two publications, Artists for the Amazon Art Book and Artists for the Amazon The Contest Magazine contain over one hundred unique pieces of artwork featuring South American wildlife, donated by amazing professional and amateur artists. We hope that by sharing with you these beautiful creatures through our art that you'll share our passion and feel good about contributing to this project.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

This project was born in the name of helping nature and charities with this focus so we're happy to announce that all profits from this project will be donated directly to The Rainforest Trust, an organisation that works to conserve forest habitats and wildlife worldwide. They put their funds where they feel they are needed most (similar to that of World Wildlife Fund) so we'll be assured that even if our contributions don't go directly to the Amazon, they will be helping an ecosystem in need.

We are excited to offer not only two publications but also prints, a team t-shirt, stickers and a charming enamel pin as a reward for backing our project and helping this amazing organisation.
Also two wonderful original pieces direct from the artists themselves. 

(Add on perks are available at checkout, you do not need the purchase the bundle to get extra items, see the FAQ for more info.)

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center

As people who are passionate about conservation, we are aware that processes like printing and clothing production can be harmful to our environment and almost entirely counter-productive to what we're trying to achieve. That's why we are working with local companies who are practised in producing eco-friendly products. Our books will be printed on recycled or sustainable paper with soy-based inks by an extremely high quality, yet environmentally conscious company. Our t-shirts will be made from organic cotton produced by fair trade companies (sweat shop free). Our pins will have recycled paper backing cards. 
Not every process in this project will be entirely without a carbon footprint but we are doing our best to ensure all major production processes are well thought out and as environmentally friendly as possible.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

Every project comes with its speed bumps. Many of the contributing artists to this project (myself included) have had previous experience with crowdfunding campaigns. We therefore know that issues can come from anywhere, our companies, our delivery processes and even ourselves. 
Our job and promise is to identify and work to solve any problems that may occur, and to ensure that these problems are not passed on to our supporters. We will keep you updated about any issues or delays if we feel it will affect you, but beyond that, together, we're up for any challenge.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

We understand that not everyone can contribute to a project like this, in fact that's how it came together in the first place. However, there are always ways to help without dipping into your hard earned income.
Please share this project on social media and with your friends and family. Even if they can't make any purchases, the further this project reaches, the more affect it will have.
Please consider donating directly to The Rainforest Trust in the future. Even a small amount can do wonders when we work as a team.

Please also consider making one change to your daily routine to help the environment. Hang your clothes out instead of using the drier. Use reusable shopping bags instead of single use plastic. Buy recycled printer paper. Use a reusable coffee mug. There are many simple options that, if everyone chips in, can make a huge difference long term.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

I would like to personally thank the following artists for their hard work and contributions to this project. Without them we would only have a half baked idea and a 3 page book. 
Arylena, Culpeo S. Fox, Hanna Hammar (Hanna's Art Studio), Kristy Brodie (KeyFeathers), Nora Potwora, Devin Elle Kurtz, Teagan Gavet, Kippycube, Kazimierz Cichoń (Jagal), Hillary Luetkemeyer (hibbary), Andrea Thiessen (Silent Ravyn), Johanna Tarkela (Johis), Andrea Radeck, Alsares, Joaquin Baldwin, Jennifer Campbell-Smith, RogueLiger, Brenda Lyons (Windfalcon), Vawie-Art, Andrea Michael, India Hackett (India's Illustrations), Robyn Drayson (Rhyu), KM Steere (keymonster), Foxinajacket, Carolina Lang, Jerry Berry, Trunchbull, Nomax, GoldenDruid, Kristen Plescow, Noxaunu, Casper Baird (Cas2o), machlojki_art, Samantha “Spot” de Graffenried, Jennifer Miller (Nambroth), Michelle O'Hanlon (Mongrelist), Alexis Joyce (Hyaena Creations), Gaia Sorrentino, Nathalie Brucker (Leaquoia), Tay Timoney (Meekor), Alyxandria Germiller (Sargassos), Vetrina Nicole Art, Alicia Mehlich (Alicetrati0n), Layla H., Sam Fuggle (ArtofSamF), BlueHunter, EJ Roberts (Dogboot), Joel Jensen, Margo Beers (WraithWolves), Jenna Oppenheimer (Boarfeathers), Dar Laviv, Gaia Raffaele (Jolie Oneiron), Barbara Gyuricza (Mau Acheron), Carly (KariChibi), Amelia Bothe, Tanja Pracht (Melextis), Ella Krober &

column1: ","Who Are We?

Hello!My name is Brianna Wines (Silvixen). I am an Australian artist and one of the contributors for the collaborative charity art project, Artists for the Amazon. Together, over fifty artists from more than twelve countries have set aside their time, passion and skills to create a collection of stunning artwork in response to the 2019 Amazon Rainforest fires. After these devastating fires many of us were asking what we could do to help our beloved environments and wildlife, especially those who didn't have a lot of money to donate and who lived far away. The answer soon became apparent that we could give up our time and use what talents we had to create an incentive for others to help us help them.
We worked to reach out to the public, seeking additional artists to contribute and have put together a second collection, the contest magazine, to show off their work and passion as well.

These two publications, Artists for the Amazon Art Book and Artists for the Amazon The Contest Magazine contain over one hundred unique pieces of artwork featuring South American wildlife, donated by amazing professional and amateur artists. We hope that by sharing with you these beautiful creatures through our art that you'll share our passion and feel good about contributing to this project.
The Rainforest Trust

This project was born in the name of helping nature and charities with this focus so we're happy to announce that all profits from this project will be donated directly to The Rainforest Trust, an organisation that works to conserve forest habitats and wildlife worldwide. They put their funds where they feel they are needed most (similar to that of World Wildlife Fund) so we'll be assured that even if our contributions don't go directly to the Amazon, they will be helping an ecosystem in need.

We are excited to offer not only two publications but also prints, a team t-shirt, stickers and a charming enamel pin as a reward for backing our project and helping this amazing organisation.Also two wonderful original pieces direct from the artists themselves. (Add on perks are available at checkout, you do not need the purchase the bundle to get extra items, see the FAQ for more info.)

Eco Rewards

As people who are passionate about conservation, we are aware that processes like printing and clothing production can be harmful to our environment and almost entirely counter-productive to what we're trying to achieve. That's why we are working with local companies who are practised in producing eco-friendly products. Our books will be printed on recycled or sustainable paper with soy-based inks by an extremely high quality, yet environmentally conscious company. Our t-shirts will be made from organic cotton produced by fair trade companies (sweat shop free). Our pins will have recycled paper backing cards. Not every process in this project will be entirely without a carbon footprint but we are doing our best to ensure all major production processes are well thought out and as environmentally friendly as possible.
Risks & Challenges

Every project comes with its speed bumps. Many of the contributing artists to this project (myself included) have had previous experience with crowdfunding campaigns. We therefore know that issues can come from anywhere, our companies, our delivery processes and even ourselves. Our job and promise is to identify and work to solve any problems that may occur, and to ensure that these problems are not passed on to our supporters. We will keep you updated about any issues or delays if we feel it will affect you, but beyond that, together, we're up for any challenge.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute to a project like this, in fact that's how it came together in the first place. However, there are always ways to help without dipping into your hard earned income.
Please share this project on social media and with your friends and family. Even if they can't make any purchases, the further this project reaches, the more affect it will have.
Please consider donating directly to The Rainforest Trust in the future. Even a small amount can do wonders when we work as a team.

Please also consider making one change to your daily routine to help the environment. Hang your clothes out instead of using the drier. Use reusable shopping bags instead of single use plastic. Buy recycled printer paper. Use a reusable coffee mug. There are many simple options that, if everyone chips in, can make a huge difference long term.
Book Artist Credits

<h2><span class=""Apple-style-span"" style=""font-size: 10px
<div>

Alyesha Wise and Jacob Winterstein here. We met in 2008 as members of Philadelphia’s inaugural poetry slam team. That year along with three other poets we represented Philadelphia at the National Poetry Slam.

Connecting to a national community of writers and performers helped us grow exponentially as artists and become closer as friends. We vowed that when the time was write, we would put on an event that strengthens the performance poetry community in Philadelphia.
Since December we've hosted a monthly workshop and poetry slam series that is open to poets of all ages and abilities.
We've already invested almost $2,000 in this project and we're barely breaking even.
We need help raising $2,500 in start-up expenses so this series can really take flight.
We believe this initial investment will make our monthly workshop and poetry slam series sustainable.

Over the first 5 months of this project we've seen how poetry slams can bring diverse groups of people together, build community and encourage poets to grow and evolve. We're turning to our supporters and lovers of poetry to help this event become a cornerstone of Philadelphia's performance poetry community (and get some cool prizes in exchange!).
The dollars and cents
We're looking raise $2,500 in 42 days. That's a 100 people who give $25. We know we can do it together.

We need to raise $700 for venue fees and insurance. We were in a great (and cheap!) venue but due to the overwhelming attendance we had to find a bigger space. With a bigger space comes a bigger cost.

We need $800 to film six 1-on-1 Street Slams and six Pigeon Shorts. In this social media age these videos are crucial to growing our audience so this event can pay for itself. Our 1 on 1 Street Slams have been viewed over 2,700 times and help expose new audiences to performance poetry.
More videos = bigger audience = sustainable event

We need to raise $1,000 to send four poets to the Southern Fried Poetry Slam in Tampa Florida. Attending national poetry competitions exposes poets to different styles, skills and resources. Poets competing at Southern Fried will bring back valuable knowledge and experience to the poetry community in Philadelphia. This makes our slams better.
Better slams = bigger audience = sustainable event.
The Pigeon Perks

We appreciate donations of any amount. In appreciation of your donation we have some fun gifts for you. From sneak peaks of the new 1 on 1 Streets Slams, free tickets to The Pigeon Presents: The Philadelphia Poetry Slam to producers credits.
Other Ways You Can Help
<div>
Share this page.
Invite your friends to come to the slam.
Watch and and share our 1 on 1 Street Slam. On YouTube search: The Pigeon Presents
Come to the slam! Our Semi Finals are on April 20th and our Grand Slam Finals are on May 4th.

7:30 Poetry Workshop
8:30 Doors Open
9:00 *sharp* show starts

$10. 
All ages welcome.
Crane Arts' Old School
1417 N. 2nd Street
Philadelphia, PA 19122
The Pigeon is an audacious bird that is everywhere.
